Reviews.Title: “Central location.”
Reviews.Author: Pedersen84
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days. The hotelroom is not top clean every day. Good breakfast. The staff were helpfull. The hotel has a cental location, if you wont to discover Amsterdam by food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: oleadam
Reviews.Content: We arrived to stay at Avenue hotel and were told we had been upgraded to a Junior suite, so immediately we were happy! Breakfast was good, the staff friendly and the location was perfect in the centre of the city and 5 min walk from the train station. The room we stayed in was nice. The only problem with our stay was the rooms had thin walls. Both nights of our stay were woken by people on the floor above walking across there room and by the springs of the bed. It was annoying to have disturbed sleep but apart from that it was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price :)”
Reviews.Author: NandLPaisley
Reviews.Content: I visited with my partner and her sister on the 2nd April 2012 we stayed for 2 nights and we could not fault the place. The hotel is clean in a good central location and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The staff can come across as rude but as long as you make an effort they eventually soften. We will return :) For all the bad reviews... DO NOT listen to them they are just an opinion and with that my dears you need to make up your own mind on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not clean”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and good buffet the morning but our rooms were not cleaned and the staff didnt care so much about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Saoirse E
Reviews.Content: I went here with my partner, my first time to Amsterdam, the hotel was perfect, it was located in the center of the everything. The room was very small but clean.Our room faced onto the main street which i thought might be a problem because i am a light sleeper, but i had no issues at all. Would definitely staff here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel for families with older children who want to share a quad room”
Reviews.Author: lynb0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2012. We had a quad room consisting of a large double (two singles pushed together) and two singles on a mezzanine floor. The room was large with UK satelite TV and good Wifi connection. There was AC and two radiators if needed. The room was clean but may be in need of a lick of paint. The bathroom was functional, loads of hot water! The step ladder to the mezzanine could be dangerous for young children but great for older kids. The reception staff are friendly. There is a luggage store. Only 5 mins from the station. Good central area for sighseeing. Breakfast is super and includes Dutch pancakes and syrup, yummy. There is a drinks vending machine and tea only 50 cents. This is a three star and good value given that breakfast is included. I booked through Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect bolthole for a romantic trip”
Reviews.Author: backpackingbarbie
Reviews.Content: Did a bit of a last minute trip with my boyfriend and this hotel was a real find. We arrived too early to check in but they changed our room so we could dump our bags and relax. They also upgraded us for free so we had a bigger room with a lovely four poster bed. The staff were very helpful and recommended a fabulous restaurant nearby. The bar area was also great and was modern but had a big fire which was quite atmospheric and we had a cocktail on the Saturday night and a hot chocolate on the Sunday before we left in the big comfy sofas. We also enjoyed the breakfast that had a wide selection of buffet items. I was really very impressed with the location, value for money and standard of this place - we are planning another trip to see Copanhagen in the summer and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. but a few things that let it down”
Reviews.Author: Flying_kiwi12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on a city break. the hotel is lovely and clean and our room was a reasonable size with all of the amenities we needed. major downside was the walls in our particular room were paper thin which ment we could hear people next door like they were in the same room! we also found the breakfast a little odd with everthing except a toaster! other than this we enjoyed our stay and were plesently suprised at how close it is to heaps of attractions and the train station. i would stay again... but might avoid room 508!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel..not the best but not the worst”
Reviews.Author: casey2222-10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girlie weekend away and it was more than fine for what we paid for it. it was clean, had a decent breakfast option and was close to many of Amseterdams attractions. We found everything we wanted to see within walking distance of the hotel. Rooms are on the small side but this is common in amsterdam.Don't go expecting five star and youll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-priced option”
Reviews.Author: WP&PJW
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel, while not in the most picturesque part of town, is easy to get to from Centraal Station - just a short walk. Staff are friendly and helpful, everyone speaks English, there's free internet access in the lobby, and breakfast is exceptionally good and plentiful. Our double room was on the small side, but clean. Note for Brits: the TV offers 3 UK BBC channels - BBC1, BBC2, and CBBC - as well as the World Service.

Reviews.Title: “Not 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. I would have thought it more a poor 2 star hotel. The facilities are very basic as we had expected but the room was dirty, had no window, was noisy at night due to the thin walls. There was no kettle in the room either. The biggest issue was the appalling quality of the breakfast - VERY little choice and the staff were most unhelpful. I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel!!! Only one positive is the location but that doesn't make up for the rest i'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Peter O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but don't approach it through the side streets at night as not all Amsterdamers are honest. Keep to the main street the Niewezijds. The staff at the hotel were helpful and pleasant. The room though small was clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: Shabba-Ranks79
Reviews.Content: Avenue hotel was perfect. Very close to the main station, but was quiet enough for a good nightâ€™s sleep. Room was a bit dated (no fridge, kettle), but the bed was comfortable. Staff not the most attentive, but breakfast was very good. Overall, great value for money and weâ€™ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: coldrock007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights earlier this month, excellent value for money, rooms very clean and hotel is in a great location in central Amsterdam. Was only a 5 minute walk from central station. Staff very friendly. Will definately stay at Avenue Hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great location, Great Value....”
Reviews.Author: zoestylianou
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband recently stayed in the Avenue Hotel for 3 nights, while in amsterdam and really enjoyed out stay. Nice, clean, comfortable bedrooms, Friendly and Helpful staff and great buffet breakfast included in the price of the room. Literally a 5 min walk from Central Station and close to coffee shops, clothes shops and red light district. In fact there was a nice chilled out coffee shop just across the road! Will definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: I was stranded in amsterdam due to the snow. I knew finding a hotel last minute was going to be hard, if rooms were available i would be paying extortionate prices. But this hotel was a great find. Price was right, its close to all main attractions and central station, breakfast was ok, rooms are clean and tidy. Staff are very friendly. I would say it was a safe hotel and would definatly be stayin there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and convenient location so very near the train station and the Boat and buses!”
Reviews.Author: Susmarijosep
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located specially if you are comming from the train station like me(came from Paris). Price was very reasonable fir breakfast is included w/c was great and very filling lots of variety. Rooms was small and unfortunate for me mine was on the first floor and by the passway so it was quite noisy. Overall it was great for a night or two!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, dirty, old”
Reviews.Author: Broomfield_Nomad
Reviews.Content: It's unfortunate the hotel is not so well maintained. Perhaps the assumption is that the great location surpasses cleanliness and poor maintenance. Pity!

Reviews.Title: “12 Visits and counting”
Reviews.Author: BigLee40
Reviews.Content: A regular traveller to Amsterdam over the years our (me + another 5) first choice of Hotel has always been The Avenue. Superbly situated within strolling distance from Central Station and easily accessed via the excellent tram service it's affordable and clean. It's a shame to write a negative about this place as I love it there, but that's it you see. It's always my first port of call, has been twice a year for 7 years but do they now me? Do they welcome my twice yearly contact with a booking request for 2,3,4 sometimes 6 guests? No. There's no warmth about the place it's just a place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room could do with freshening up a little.”
Reviews.Author: amity1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Check in staff were friendly. The lobby area was clean and tidy.The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. The room was ok. A bit tired and could do with being painted. The bath towel had holes in, the mattress was lumpy and one of the bedside lights was not working. For nearly Â£150 a night I would have expected it to be of a higher standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good size room and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: Located very close to station. Rooms was clean and nice size. Breakfast was also good. Would definitely stay again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TheHolas
Reviews.Content: I actually think from reading some of these reviews that some people find absolutely anything to complain about!!! I think for what i paid for this it was fab! There was 3 of us in our room! Room massive & clean! could maybe be doing with more lights but hey i got over it! the FREE breakfast was also very nice and staff friendly! i do agree with the comments on the blonde hair girl, think its time she got a new job ha ha!! i loved Amsterdam and will be returning and will stay at Avenue Hotel! after all you are in Amsterdam so only really there to sleep ?? !! bed was comfy too!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as some reviews said....”
Reviews.Author: Teresa C
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for three nights and the Hotel is really very well located near de Central Station and in the center of Amsterdam. The remarks are about de dimensions of the room, very small, sometimes the problem are the photos that are in the website that shows "fantastic rooms", and about the cleanliness, for example I just left a cleanex under my pillow and it was there after the room cleaned and the carpet need a deep clean. It was good if they can put a small light near the desk, I need work and I have no light. A good breakfast. The Reception Staff made is job correctly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: sueCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: I just came back from spending the weekend with a group of friends in Amsterdam on Avenue Hotel. My husband and I have stayed there once before and chose the place again mainly because of the location. I was a little worried when I read the reviews as it was 4 years since our last stay. But we were not disappointed. Some people in our group were assigned somewhat small rooms, but all were clean and functional. Breakfast includes a variety of cold and warm food. Everything standard, but all very nice. All in all I still believe this is a very good value for money hotel, in one of the very best locations in Amsterdam. You are less than 500 meters from the central train station, about 200 meters from the pedestrian shopping street, 500 from the 9 little streets etc. etc. So - for your absolutely fine tourist class hotel in an excellent location in Amsterdam - don't worry about booking this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good rate.”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed for three nights at The Avenue Hotel and found it to be fine for the price paid through an online booking agency. I had stayed at this hotel once before, so knew that remarks about it being a bad hotel were not true and were comments of people who wouldn't be satisfied anywhere at whatever price. I booked a single room and yes they are quite small but you are not spending all day in the room, just at night when you are asleep, so it doesn't matter. The rooms are clean and comfortable and it is great that you get free Wi-Fi thrown in which meant that it never cost me anything for expensive mobile charges to keep in touch with my family as I could use 'Skype' on my laptop. The breakfast each morning was fine and kept me going until lunchtime. There was a good selection of food and drink on offer, so something for everyone. Some people have complained about the attitude of the staff but maybe they should look at their own attitude as I found each member of staff that I had contact with to be more than helpful. Perhaps guests would get better response if they too were more courteous to the staff...it does help!! I would definitely stay here again if I could get the same good rate as the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Much better then some reviews said!!”
Reviews.Author: Run_Bunny_Run
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is within 5 mins of Centraal Station, Red light district and main shopping areas etc... All staff I meet where happy, polite and professional, the bedroom was more then adequate and very well cleaned apart from the carpet which other guests had spilt something on, so it needed a deep clean or replacing (not the fault of the cleaning staff)... Bathroom was clean with towels, soap and shower gel etc Breakfast was great all fresh with plenty of chose and lots of it, the staff looked like they enjoyed working there, as did all the staff in the Hotel. Would I use this Hotel again or recommend this to others? A definitely Yes!!!! Stayed: 20 to 22 November 2011

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa79_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel avenue is in a great location, 5 mins from the red light district and dam square, 10 mins from centraal station. the hotel staff are great, really helpful and polite. we has a little mix up on arrival, they had no record of us but we had our payment sheet with us so it was sorted in 5 mins. had a large room, which is rare in amsterdam but the shower leaked all over the floor, not a big prob cos we had loads of towels in the room, maybe thats what they were for, lol. fab experience will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aw man. This hotels sucks big time”
Reviews.Author: Wim H
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpets, small rooms, lousy breakfast (bad coffee, little breads (not freshly baked), dry pancakes (every day), crappy sausages, old cheese and meat,...), bad rooms with dirty shower curtains... (in my room, and my 2 other colleagues had the same problem). The blond girl at the reception seemed to hate to work over there and was absolutely not friendly. And overall, the price is way too high for what you get in return. One positive point: the location is ideal and close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Fosfor
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this hotel, but ok if you just need a clean place to sleep. I picked this hotel because of the location, wich is very good for a weekend tourist like myself. The room was quite small, had a bed, a closet, a small desk and Ã¥ TV with three channels I think. The bathroom was clean and nice, but the bathroom floor became flooded if I took a shower lasting more than two minutes. Straight boring hotel breakfast, but totally ok. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The biggest minus was the cleaning lady, who for some reason spoke, or more like screamed, on the phone the entire time while working. This woke us up and kept us wake for all of the mornings we were there, as she screamed away whilest cleaning in the hallway and the neighbouring rooms. Concidering the prices for hotels in central Amsterdam is really high, this is an ok hotel for the price I guess, but i wouldn't go here for Ã¥ romantic weekend or a fancy occation.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for that quality”
Reviews.Author: Hilven
Reviews.Content: Staff is not really polite and don't even try to understand what customer is asking about. Especially the blond girl behind the reception did not hide her empathy. Breakfast sucks big time. No clean forks , spoons ,... Tiny tiny rooms ... with shower curtains which were stained.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rate”
Reviews.Author: TimothyFFT
Reviews.Content: I found the avenue hotel to be in an ideal location, just a few blocks walk from the main train station. Rooms were very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with hotel or amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0075
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled up to the hotel their was garbage by the street waiting for pick-up which finally came the day we checked out. (3 1/2 days later). The hotel is pretty outdated and could use some renovation. It is centrally located and we found the staff friendly. Their were 35 of us and check in and out was effortless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: rjmnc2000
Reviews.Content: Could not beat the location for the price. Walking distance from the train station and all other tourist destinations. Not exactly the lap of luxury, carpet and furnishings a little dated, but served it's purpose as a place to sleep and explore Amsterdam. Did not accept American Express which I was told they did prior to my making reservations, not a big deal. Overall not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prabhu090
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Oct 2011. This is a great choice for a central location that is not loud or nosiy at night. Very close to Central train station & centrally located to hit most tourist spots in town. 20 mins to Schipol airport by train & cost only 8 Euro for a weekend return ticket. The staff were very friendly; they helped recommend & book a great tour of the country side last minute. Would def stay here again! Free Internet & breakfast was a big +

Reviews.Title: “The hotel I pick, even when my per diem lets me pay more”
Reviews.Author: edwardjayallan
Reviews.Content: My work frequently calls for me to transit Amsterdam, and I enjoy visiting Amsterdam on my own anyhow. For several years, the Avenue Hotel is the hotel that I've been choosing even when my per diem would let me pay for a more expensive or fancier hotel. As others have noted, the Avenue Hotel is convenient to the Central Station -- a couple of blocks walk or just one stop on the tram (streetcar. Side note: People should remember to buy the 24-hour transit pass, or a longer one if they are staying longer.) It is on a main street, but a quiet one -- a short walk from a number of tourist spots (and shopping) and on streetcar lines that serve many others. One thing to keep in mind -- this is essentially a "boutique" hotel, not part of a chain (although I believe that the Belleview Hotel on the same street, but a bit closer to the train station, is a sister property), and it is in a couple of old buildings that have been linked together, so if you are hoping/expecting a "Hilton" type of experience, you'll likely be disappointed, but I have always found it more than adequate, even when I can pay more, and it's the hotel I choose even when I'm paying out of my own pocket. The rooms that I've been in have been on the small size, but the hotel has been frequently upgrading their quality -- there is now wifi available throughout the hotel, and the television has a great many channels. My bathroom had a shower, essentially open, in the bathroom (no tub), so the floor can get quite wet. But that's no big deal. I don't think there's a restaurant or, really, a bar, but, hey, this is Amsterdam and there are ample places to eat and to drink. Breakfast (included) is a buffet featuring an excessive array of cold cuts for someone who should watch his/her cholesterol, plus eggs and bacon and Dutch pancakes plus juices and breads (plural) and rolls. There is no reason to leave breakfast still feeling hungry! I think that rates may be somewhat cheaper if you go through a booking service, but I have found the hotel to be responsive in tight times when I have contacted it directly. The hotel is fairly small, so not infrequently it sells out. I've found the front desk staff to be helpful. Please note, though, that there is no bellperson, so you have to bring your bags to your room yourself. For me, that's not been a problem, since (a) I can take care of my own stuff without need of help and (b) as so many other people do, I leave my luggage in a locker or in the left-luggage area at the airport and just take what I need for the length of time that I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I want”
Reviews.Author: HenrikSMRN Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I don't like large, fancy, luxurious hotels, but I don't like dirty, cramped rats holes either. Avenue sums up exactly what I am looking for: close to train station, clean room with enough space, comfortable bed, good variety at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Well located reasonable priced 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ERBfd
Reviews.Content: The two best reasons to stay at the Avenue are location and reasonable cost. It is a few minutes walk from Centraal Station and neighborhoods such as the Jordaan are an easy walk. For our last stay we booked a double room. Upon arrival we were taken to a decent size room with a very small bathroom. There was no tub and only a curtain separated the very small shower from the toilet with little room to move. It looked out on a shaft between buildings. We requested, and quickly received, a room change to one with a tub. The front desk said that we should have requested a room with a tub and not just a shower. We had no idea such tubless rooms existed in the hotel and we have stayed at the hotel several times. Our second room looked out over the alley to the right of the entrance. It was light and airy and fairly quiet but the free wifi did not work. I had to go into the hall or to the lobby to get access. We again asked for and the next day were given another room where the wifi worked. If wifi access is important you should make it clear when reserving a room and avoid rooms toward the back of the hotel by the alley. Our third room was much larger and very comfortable. The breakfast was better than other three star hotels we have stayed in Amsterdam and the staff was helpful. There is a safe in the lobby for valuables, which you can use for a small fee per day. The building above the entrance in the photos of the hotel is not part of the hotel. The buildings to the left in photographs are part of the hotel with rooms facing the street. The hotel is put together from several odd shaped buildings and size of layout of rooms varies tremendously. The Tram stop for lines 1, 2, 5, 13 and 17 is less than a block away. Trams are a great way to get around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit1234
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they upgraded up from a twin room to a double superior room for free - the room was a good size and the bed was firm and comfortable. Can't beat the location, easy walk to many canals, the Anne Frank House, the Jordaan district, and many restaurants. The free breakfast is great - many things to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value 3*hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HB00763
Reviews.Content: This is an average three star hotel that is quite reasonably priced with a great location. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the train station and is within walking distance of most of the city's attractions. It is near the canals and the hop on hop off boats as well as near the shopping areas and many eating places. The hotel itself is good for the price, the rooms are comfortable but can noisy if you are loacted near the alley behind the hotel or on the main street. We found the staff to be quite friendly and helpful, breakfast is average but ok for the price. There are lifts to all floors but no free internet. However If you want a less expensive (but still good value) centrally located hotel and don't want to pay for unnecessary luxuries then this hotel is a really good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ekflyer
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was good overall. I am still in my room, about to check out in an hour. My check in was quick, breakfast was great and included in the hotel price and there is free high speed WIFI. The beds are comfy and the room was very spacious. I had a few issues with my room however: The carpeting was an eyesore with huge stains, the bathroom could use some cleaning around the edges, the room had a musky, pungent smell that lasted for hours before the air conditioning finally cleared it up. And there is quite a bit of dust in the room. I woke up every morning with a very dry throat and stuffed nostrils. But to be fair, none of these issues took anything away from my total experience! The staff were friendly, room and bed was clean, location was 2 minute walk from Centraal Station but the room was very quiet. I would definitely stay here again! Wanted to add that when I called the hotel directly, they quoted me a nightly rate of â‚¬150 for a single room for one person. When I booked through hotel.com, I got the same room for â‚¬170 for 2 nights. Almost 50% cheaper... my advice is to go with an online booking site. Most other "hotels" charged about â‚¬85-â‚¬95 per night and I would hardly classify them as "hotel" rooms. This place had an elevator, a real breakfast with bacon/eggs/etc and nicer rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GreenBeansSuisse
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Avenue whenever i come to Amsterdam for a business trip. 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station, and near Dam square. There is a tram stop nearby to get you into town. Single rooms are small, but adequate (although the shower in the last room was so small, you could not get in our out without soaking the rest of the bathroom). Breakfast extensive. Service is not special, but I have never experienced a rude receptionist. A reasonable price, and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist very rude, swore at me”
Reviews.Author: kdsDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Very poor service. When checking the receptionist was very rude. Asked me to pay city tax, which I duly paid. I asked about the 3 bed room, I was told to "figure it out, this is not 5 star hotel." I later realised I had paid â‚¬5 too much. When I asked about it, she insisted that she was correct. As I was walking off, I was told to " get the f...k out". This is not the sort of customer service one would expect anywhere. Absolutely disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small and not expensive. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: kayshatz
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very nice. There was a safe service at the lobby. Looking back, the breakfast was tasty. The hotel felt very safe. You had to use you room key to call the elevator, so strangers weren't able to go up to the rooms. The rooms were clean. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “I'll give this one a miss next time”
Reviews.Author: Deery81
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, but the switchboard lady was unhelpful when friends tried to contact me in my room. Long story, but if you want to be connected with the outside world (i.e have your friends phone to you when you are staying at this hotel) they may find it frustrating - mine did. Several attempts required, and impossible to get sense or good service from the switchboard lady.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Mentat72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. A 5 minute walk to the train station, 5 minutes from Dam Square, 5 Minutes to The Damrak, 10 minutes to the Red Light District, 10 minutes to the Anne Frank House, and so on. There are convenience stores, bars, restaurants and coffee shops aplenty, all over town, not just near the Avenue. The room was small but comfortable. Typical for Europe. It is cold in February but we were fine in the room. The breakfast is top notch with many choices, none of which change day to day however. The staff was helpful and pleasant. I would stay here again with no hesitation, but the prices have gone up dramatically since February.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TolerantTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked it because it was in walking distance of train station and where our friends live in Amsterdam but we still had a bit of hard time finding it. The hotel appears to be in three buildings behind store fronts as well, so finding the front door was hard. Maybe they need better signage -- facing the way travellors come from Centraal square? Air conditioner worked well! Don't open windows -- we were on an inside room and due to heavy rains much water collected on roof tops below -- moths and other insects! Bathroom was small although bed room size was adequate for 2 of us medium sized people with two large suitcases. Color TV was a plus but typical small Euro screen. Breakfast food was okay and plentiful but grumpy staffer! Room Security good with locked elevator that needed room key to activate but safe boxes are in room in public lobby! Hmm--we didn't use!. Basically, very adequate for price considering how expensive hotels are in Amsterdam. Front desk staff helpful. Restaurants, bars and sightseeing all in good walking or tram distance.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get...”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in a cupboard-size single room. After complaining of a putrid sewage smell from the shower drain after my first night there, the receptionist didn't seem too surprised and promised to change my room. I somehow expected some kind of compensation for this inconvenience i.e. a larger double room perhaps - but was dissappointed to be relocated to an equally small single room. Well, I tried. The location of the Avenue Hotel is excellent and the breakfast selection was ample. Overall, my stay was satisfactory - but not at all special. It constantly amazes me that these kind of establishments could do a bit more to engage with their customers and make them feel more welcome, ensuring that they will return or at least recommend this particular hotel to others. This was not the case at the Avenue. I would only recommend it if you are on a tight budget - what you see is what you get - no more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikelly46 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent, fuss free, spacious, quiet and close enough to amenities. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location, room and service left a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Jenz99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the Avenue Hotel to explore Amsterdam and get over jet lag before heading to Germany. As others have pointed out the location is excellent, within walking distance of the train station as well as many of the sights. We were fortunate to get a room in the main building that did not face the street, so it was very quiet. I also appreciated the air conditioning, as it was hot our first day in Amsterdam. The one thing I did not like about the room was the bathroom. The toilet is in the corner behind the door and tough to get to even with the door closed, and there is no actual shower - just a curtain that wraps around a portion of the floor. Water ended up getting everywhere, and I was afraid to use the hairdryer for fear of getting electrocuted. The other issue we had with our trip was with the front desk staff. We had family in Amsterdam that dropped off a welcome package for us, including champagne and chocolates. We never received the package - did not find out about it until a couple days later when our family asked what we thought of the champagne. Fortunately we were able to retrieve the package the day before we flew home, as it was still sitting behind the desk with our name and room number on it. Disappointed that it never made it to our room during our stay! Otherwise our stay was fine, had no issues with bedbugs or cleanliness like some other reviews. Breakfast was good including a variety of meats and cheese, along with hot cooked American items like eggs and bacon. Getting around the day we left town was a bit of a challenge as there was a transit strike, fortunately found a cab driver willing to take us to the edge of town to retrieve our car! Seems to be an issue in Europe this summer, as the German train workers called a one day strike during our visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away- Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: fooddancetravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bed bugs!!! My friend and I stayed in this hotel on my birthday trip to Amsterdam. It WAS in a great location like everybody says and I have to say.... everything else in the hotel was generally ok for a 3 star hotel... but our room had bed bugs! We should have gotten the hint when we went in and there was dust all over furniture and they had to replace some of the bulbs ... it looked like they hadn't used the room in a while.... we only stayed for one night there, something kept pinching/ biting me that night... at first I thought I was imagining it until my friend and I started itching from the bed bug bites about 3 days later (they take a couple of days to start itching) ... and we had the red round bed bug bites all over our skin! Worst of all, since we weren't aware of what had happened in time...we must have carried them home on our clothe and luggage because my house is now infested! The exterminator says I am lucky I caught it early.... they have to spray twice but once you have them they are so hard to get rid of.... my advice STAY AWAY .. don't risk it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: realyorkies
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. The room was very light with 2 big windows and size was ok and although the bathroom was small it had bath with overhead shower. The.breakfast was excellent better than some of the more expensive hotels I have stayed in. Friendly staff and the thing that matters most to me it was VERY CLEAN.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: deejay90210
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel but a great location. Just 5 minutes walk from the central railway station and the Dam square. Near tram station too. A very central place to stay and move around in Amsterdam. Rooms are small, but adequate and clean. The reception staff was very helpful and courteous. Good value for money. Would like to stay here again, just because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was back in college ... but my back is not like it was in college!”
Reviews.Author: tozaisen
Reviews.Content: Location is fine. easy to get to from the station. this is true. Room was very very small. The bed was terrible. I felt like I was back in my college days. I'm not in college anymore. I think one would be better off getting a hotel with some charm in the Jordan area, etc. The breakfast was good, which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “near central train station”
Reviews.Author: goneAlberta
Reviews.Content: We had a nice, clean, small room. The breakfast was typical and was in a bright room. We were able to walk from the river boat dock with our wheeled lugage and it is a 2 block walk to the trian station. Safety deposit boxes are available. (ask at reception)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hurrah_NOIDA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 400 metres from the Centraal. Its right next to some pretty good 5 stars but the price is about 1/3 of these, and as a result if you do not book in advance, you will always find it full. The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast. For a business traveller, the breakfast is awesome, as there is nothing it does not have. Starts early and the end time is not that rigid. They normally Always bend it a bit to accommodate you. The coffee shop Internet is a lil bit expensive but then thats Europe for you. The coffee shop serves lovely beer and excellent sandwiches that are too good to be true and you can get these till midnight. The good thing is that there really is no need for a restaurant since there are several across and on the same street, Indian, Greek, Mexican etc. within 25 metres walking distance. Love the place

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ccdeblaze
Reviews.Content: I'll say good location just cause everyone else says good location. Yes it's central but it's also crazy busy. I wish I'd done a tad more research, spent a bit more money and gotten a bit more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Better Value somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: ZzzzTravelMan
Reviews.Content: Although from the reviews and the photos it looked like this would be a good hotel, it wasn't!! Felt like I had booked a Motel 6! Carpets were dirty and smelly, towels smelled TERRIBLE. Paid $160 a night and $230 for the last night. We had room 316 so certainly DON'T take that room. Staff were good, helpful no issues there. I think you can certainly get more for your money somewhere else. It was close to the Central Station and in walking distance. Hopes this helps. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Alichia58
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, clean rooms, comfy beds, all you need to explore Amsterdam by foot or bike!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: mealsim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Hotel in Amsterdam for 3 nights. It was within walking distance to Central Railway Station, Dam Square and most of the main sites of interest. Although the rooms were not very large, they were clean and comfortable and the breakfasts were very good - choice of continental or English. We had rooms at the back which, although they didn't have a main street view, were very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: V3rin
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, illumination no good (small window), bathroom small with no bathtub, after you took a shower the floor was wet. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: abrostr1
Reviews.Content: Great location.. within walking distance to Central Station,trams, many shops and restaurants. Staff very helpful. Free wifi. Breakfast great with many selections. Rooms on the small side but this is expected in Europe so was fine with us. We are only in the room to sleep, shower, and eat breakfast. Happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: geri412
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic- five minutes walk to the Centraal station and a tram stop- to get to Rijksmuseum and VanGogh Museum- is less than a minute away. About a five minute walk away is Dam Street where you can find shops, restaurants, and french-fry stands. At Dam Street you can also get the tram to the zoo, the Hermitage Museum, or Rembrandt's House. The breakfast had hot and cold foods, fresh fruit as well as canned, bread and rolls and was replenished often. The room was small, but for just sleeping it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location - expensive for what you receive”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room and loved the location. It was convenient to Central station and all sites are in walking distance. The 3rd bed was a fold down, which was OK. The view overlooked a street with a tram, that was OK too. Shower was good. Door in bathroom was cracked and nbroken and the room was absolutely no-frills. It is a 2 star at best. Breakfast was good. Decent options.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOOD”
Reviews.Author: jasonsay
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel good reception and nice clean rooms ! Central station 5min !

Reviews.Title: “it could have been better if...”
Reviews.Author: uzotti
Reviews.Content: ...we had newer bed matresses which were not deformed like a hammock. ...we had a double bed instead of twins eventough we asked for it while booking. ...we had cleaner and less worn out pillows. despite all this, our room getting cleaned everyday, quality of the breakfast they serve and the location -it is excellent by the way- makes us forget all these negative impressions. this is a pleasant and a god value hotel for people whom like to be in the heart of the city and dont expect much.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel ! good servers !”
Reviews.Author: aceeeee
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast good location ! 5min central station!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but not more”
Reviews.Author: Evgeny S
Reviews.Content: "+": perfect location, close to Rail Station, shop street and coffee shops; free wi-fi; "-": rooms are not very clean;

Reviews.Title: “Book in advance for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonnieGloucester
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the money. Centrally located, good breakfast with plenty to choose from. Good clean room. Payed the same money as when I stayed at the Delta, on the damrak. Big mistake. Book well in advance and stay here. Will diffinately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Hopkins Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just off the main Red Light District, however it was very quite on a evening whilsy trying to sleep. The hotel was clean and very friendly and the staff could not do enough for you. We arrived in Amsterdam early at 9am in the morning and thinking we could not book in until 2pm left our cases at the central railway station which cost us Â£10. Once we had book in at the hotal we found out that they had a luggage roomk which we could have left the case at for free. We used this facility on the day of our departture and checked out of the hotel at 11am and returned to pick our cases up at 4:30pm. The Brealfast was outstanding with a choice of most items hot and cold from the buffet breakfast. This hotel is well situated for all the main attreactions which are just a short walking distamce away. All in all a great hotel which we would definately use again if and when we return to amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling_matt_11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was conveniently located near the Centraal Station, the Main Railway Station, where there are frequent Trains to Schiphol Airport. My Room was at the back of the Hotel, so the room was quiet, although I don't think the Road it was on would have been particularly noisy, despite the Tram route going past the outside of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: loopy14
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have stayed in this hotel many times. It is centrally located which we loved, also we found the hotel quite modestly priced compared to many of the other ones. We loved the cleanliness of the hotel and the delicious breakfast every morning - the mini pancakes and syrup are my favourite!! I will be going back to The Avenue with no hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: hughdivers30
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights over the weekend the location is great walking distance for pretty much everything if you're reasonably fit, very basic but done the job im not fussy but for people who are the double room is 2 single beds pushed together and they are not very comfortable, self service breakfast was ok to start the day selection of hot and cold food and drinks it's ok nothing special,plenty near hotel for food drink ,shops,coffee shops everything would definitely recomend this hotel unless you're a fusspot go elsewere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brill location”
Reviews.Author: janeMansfield_Notts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, close to central station, dam square red light district etc. However if you are looking for up market accommodation then go elsewhere. The place is clean and warm, and breakfasts are good. It get's very crowded from 8-9.30 at brekkie, so go early or late. The rooms are on the small side, and some bathrooms are dated/shabby. I could imagine it being noisy in the rooms at the front of the hotel ( from trams etc). Don't expect views from the room either we looked out to other room windows and the kitchen roof. This didn't bother us we were there for the sights and break, and this hotel served it's purpose well. We didn't pay over the odds, which meant more money to spend in Amsterdam. We would recommend this hotel, if you want a bed to sleep in in a great location and a fairly good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Would use again”
Reviews.Author: tc_spurs
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, and I have been in some worse ones. Location good and easy to walk around to see the sites. Breakfast was good with a selection of hot food and continental. Staff ok and helpful. Coffee Shop down the road if needed. Do not use the Red Light across the road you get ripped off :)

Reviews.Title: “Small triple room with tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: KiddiYo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and offered a very good breakfast (assortment of hot and cold items). We had to double check that the front desk had given us the right room, as we had requested 3 beds. The 3rd bed (another single) folded out of the closet/storage shelves. It was comfortable, but you had to crawl over it to get in and out of the room. The tiny bathroom (barely big enough for one) had dual vanities and minimal counterspace. Room was way too hot - we even kept the window open.

Reviews.Title: “the only good thing is the best location”
Reviews.Author: orsh6
Reviews.Content: the hotel has location,location,location. the room is tiny and smelly, the bathroom tiny tiny tiny and not comftrble they didnt clean the room until after noon and the smells of the smokes marihuana was all over the breakfast was boring and poor the only thing i saw as a advantage was defenetly the location near dam sq and the centrall station

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: riffrafff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avenue Hotel in Amsterdam last week for 3 nights. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is close to Centraal Station and central to visits to key attractions in the city. We were disappointed that our non-smoking room did stink of cigarettes when we first entered it however the staff were apologetic and were more than happy to move us to another room. The room was clean and was cleaned every day with fresh towels. The beds were very comfortable too. Breakfast catered for all tastes and was very good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: linnmac
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel were mixed--some good, others not so, therefore I booked with the idea that at least it was a convenient locale for us. We had booked a single room for myself (#204) and double for 2 friends (#216). These rooms were small, as expected, and seemed recently renovated, with tiny but spotless bathrooms. The double had a tub/shower combo and the single was shower only. Carpets were new and clean (other reviews had mentioned "sticky/stained carpets"). From conversations with others staying at the same time, it appears that some rooms are not renovated, and have older bathrooms; more worn appearance. I did not see these rooms so can only state that the two rooms we were given were quite satisfactory and good value for Amsterdam, which is pricey. The breakfast buffet is outstanding: a bright and attractive room on lower level; assortment of hot dishes (soft boiled or scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausages, potatoes); cheeses and sliced cold meats; fresh sliced fruits; yogurt; assorted cereals and breads, as well as tomatoes and lettuce, and unlimited coffee or tea and juices. The lift is secure: you must enter your room key card to use it. The convenience of a lift rather than the steep stairs in some of the hotels at this price becomes very important after you've hauled even one backpack up or down a narrow flight or two. The locked luggage room was great for storing our backpacks as we arrived early in the morning before check-in was possible. Also we never encountered any unpleasant staff, so can't comment on some negative statements others made. All in all--the pluses definitely outweigh any minuses. Good Value... We were there 3 nights and would return again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for everthing in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mini1275
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean just had a large shower room very hot water , the breakfast was good kept us going while our evening meal.Luggage room to dump your case on the last day which worked out well as our pick up wasn't while 5. Would definately use this hotel again . Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is location!!”
Reviews.Author: RachelHighlands_uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel on arriving appears nice the decor etc is lovely then you meet receptionist who is just rude no smile, manners nothing. When leaving the lift upstairs you would think you are in a different hotel, very run down scabby looking. Room was not very clean and our "double" room was 2 single beds pushed together with 2 single duvets. When you look out your window all you can see is people haning out the windows smoking in the apparently non smoking hotel. It didnt have much atmosphere as the bar didnt even have a barman you had to ask receptionist to go to bar if you wanted a drink. The one positive thing is the location 2 minute wlk from everything!! We didnt need a taxi once so that was the upside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast, Tired Decor”
Reviews.Author: joshuasiandave
Reviews.Content: Lovely location not far from all sights. Felt comfortable staying with young child. Very safe. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Stayed in an attic room with a small loft for children. Very sweet. Hotel staff were lovely. Excellent breakfast in clean surroundings. The decor of the room could do with updating but still OK for a two day stay. Pretty expensive more than Â£50 each per night but Amsterdam is expensive. Glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor room in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: haymaker58
Reviews.Content: Our room in this hotel was not nice. The furniture was worn, the carpet was dirty and sticky, and there were not electrical outlets near any mirror. The bath was ok. There was no way to keep out bright lights, even though they advertise blackout curtains. Reception and breakfast and location are all positives.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty and old - plus expensive”
Reviews.Author: KennyGMarlow_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked late so was expensive for what it is - Â£122 for a night. Good location close to station (10 mins walk max) Terrible room (number 605) Interior was tatty with stained carpets, very saggy beds, super cheap flat pack wardrobe and the stink of old smoke was strong. Small rubbish TV, no drinking water in room. It just felt really dirty and in need of serious refit - OR a serious drop in price and target the stag do market. I was unlucky to get room 605 as it overlooks the air conditioning units for the whole block and there was a constant rumbling hum that penetrated the badly fitting window. But I wouldn't return even to a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annie2301
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. Queens Day so the hotel was full, but staff were very helpful. Room was small but tidy and clean, bathrolom same, small but clean. Massive breakfast room, and just minutes from Dam Square and Central Station

Reviews.Title: “spotless room,but small single”
Reviews.Author: alicedl
Reviews.Content: newly refurbed bathroom,and excellent aircon - not too noisy.really great convienient location and friendly staff.good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “location and breakfast, no more to say”
Reviews.Author: spartaroma
Reviews.Content: spartaroma Turkey We had a pleasant stay at the â€œAvenue Hotel Amsterdamâ€� for 6 days for holiday. Although it is in the heart of the city, it is comfortable and safe. It is very close to central station, 5 min by walking and entertainment area, Red Light District, Dam square, Anne Frank museum. Tram stop is 25 meter away to reception. Our room was on the top floor about 10msq and shiny. The windows are not on the outer wall, they are as if on the ceiling. Because the outer wall is not straight, it is rather 45 degree inclined inside. The ceiling dimension is smaller than the floor dimension. This oblique wall decreases the area of the room. The room seems spacious but not in fact. This kind of room is not convenient for taller people (hit the head to the oblique wall). The size of the bathroom is small but well organized. The drainage of the tub was poor. The aspirator of the bathroom is continously functioning, interestingly you can hear the noise when you are in the bathroom, but not when you are in the room. The wooden component of the furnitures appears to be new but the textiles and rug on the floor are worn out. The room has no minibar and safe-case. The breakfast is excellent including 2-3 kinds of cheese, vegetables and fruit salads. Maids of the breakfast hall are ,not friendly. The staff of the reception are professional but not good-humored except male staff. The hotel seems to be expensive hotel for the room standarts but it is convenient, worth the money when compared the vicinity hotels. We would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A great location to crash if your wanting a central location for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: RAW1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably central placed 10 mins walk from the central station and about 5 mins from Dam Square. I was travelling with my Son on a bonding weekend. The hotel was easy to find and we were welcomed at 09:45 with our room ready to be occupied. The room was a little small but quiet adequate for two blokes on a long weekend. The Bathroom was a wet room with shower toilet and basin and two small single beds were also provided. Air con was also provided. It was clean and tidy. The public areas were also very tidy. The Hotel only seems to do Breakfast which was a typical mixture of hot and cold offerings. The hot was typical eggs etc and was a little cooler than I like but the cold buffet was excellent. The coffee was strong as I like it. Over all the hotel was just what we were looking for. I'd clealry recommend it for anyone who wants a place to crash whilst visiting the city. If I were there on business then it would be a little inadequate to work in the room, but the WiFi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chiccabom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in May last year. The location is perfect - it's in the middle of Amsterdam and just a short walk from the central station. The hotel is small, but cozy inside. The rooms are ok, it was cozy but a little worn. Still, the hotel was charming. The price is a bit high for such rooms, but that may be because of the location. When we were booking it (about 4 months in advance) we where told that we would get a special offer which was very cheap. That did not happen, the price was ca 1000 NOK/night, I think it's probably around 150â‚¬. Because the hotel is in the city centre you hear "tram" and traffic noises from 6:00/6am to 00:00/12pm (not very loud in morning and evenings, but a bit annoying with the dinging from the tram all the time). A bit expensive for the room standard, and not very professional booking staff, but we had a pleasant stay at this hotel. I would recommend it to you if the purpose of the trip is shopping and you want to stay in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a brilliant city”
Reviews.Author: ben97
Reviews.Content: Very good base to explore Amsterdam. Not the most luxurious but good sleep (such that we had) was good. Breakfast also very good. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: matkavirkailija
Reviews.Content: We did a quick stopover in Amsterdam and stayed at the Avenue Hotel which was wonderful. Perfect location. Lovely room with four single beds - two of which were on a loft for the teenagers. Breakfast was delicious and service very good. Beds were most comfortable and shower had plenty of pressure and a nice showerhead. Interesting feature was that you needed to use your room key to keep the electric going which was a great way to save energy while you were not in the room. AC worked very well and you could also open the window for a nice breeze. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 star comfort 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: NadsNDave
Reviews.Content: pro's - location...location... good breakfast ok facilities (room safe / tv / kettle / fridge) Con's - no floor drain in bathroom so after showering (unable to seal in the water via shower curtain)it was like wading through a swamp or using up all towells to dry Cleaning not up to standard and sporadic Hall / outside noise Window/door opened out onto open area above kitchen so had ventilator noise etc staff sometimes not the most helpful (young)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for Valentines weekend and was totally satisfied. The location was perfect - you can walk to this hotel from anywhere - station, red light district, museums. The breakfast was very good, buffet style and had plenty of variety. The rooms were old and slightly shabby but clean and perfectly adequate. The staff spoke brilliant English and were happy to give advice about where to eat or to give directions. Due to the location of this hotel, I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone. I will definitely stay here again if I'm lucky enough to be in Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Watdabni
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, very central - 5 minutes from Amsterdam Centraal Station. I think the room (401) had recently been refurbished as it all seemed very new and it was this that provided the only slight niggles. There was no drawer space for clothes, no towel rail (only a single hook) and the shower drained too slowly. Other than those minor points I couldn't fault the place or the staff. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Likely to go back when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TOMTOMCARIBOU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised at the great location. An easy walk from the main railway station and Dam Square only a few minutes away. We spent a lot of time over in the Jordaan area of canals and found the little cafes and bars very atmospheric. The hotel itself was fine, the bedroom adequate although the bathroom was a little on the small side. Breakfast buffet was of a good standard with plenty of selection both hot and cold. We would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again when next we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, simple room”
Reviews.Author: UrbanSuper
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to Dam, Red Light District and train station. Standard breakfast with complement of egg & bacon and fruit . Polite cleaning and dining staff. Small and dark room (105), but clean. The hotel was fully booked at our stay, but if not you should try to get other then 105. So as always with a fixed budget, you'll have to choose between location and standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable bed, great breakfast, what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: SC1972
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Amsterdam for the first time, and decided to use this hotel after reading the reviews on this website. The hotel is situated in an ideal central location in Amsterdam, yet there is not a problem getting to sleep at night as the street isn't too noisy, and the bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever used in any hotel. The bedroom and bathroom aren't huge but are perfectly adequate for a 3 star hotel and are spotlessly clean. The buffet breakfast is good value, offering a wide range of options, from scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage, to ham, cheese, fresh fruit, and a variety of breads. Overall, this hotel is very good value, and I would certainly use it if visiting Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gill2001c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Easy to find, close to Central Station, Canal trips, Red light district, Dam Square and quieter canal-side walks. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby too. Although the hotel was located on a busy road it was still quiet at night so we had no problems sleeping. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and spacious and the breakfast was plentiful and consisted of a wide variety of hot and cold food. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: wavewatcher
Reviews.Content: Traveled with friends for a total of three rooms, two doubles and a triple. All of us asked for different rooms after seeing the first assigned. The three women in the triple changed 3 times, and eventually paid E20 extra a night for a quad room because the others were just doubles with a cot jammed in. My husband and I asked for a renovated room and stayed in #98, just off lobby, clean and new. Receptionist warned us the room might be noisy because it faced the street, but there were two sets of windows and it was February, so street noise was not an issue, and we were comfortable for our 3 night stay. Security was good, lobby door locked at night, and guests were buzzed in by front desk staff, who were helpful with recommendations and directions. This hotel was centrally located close to central station and Dam Square, but I'm not so sure I would stay here again after seeing my friend's rooms and of course, there are many hotels in the area to choose from. We did not hear about any thefts from rooms like other posters, also found the breakfast buffet fine and included in price. There is a fresh water and ice dispenser off the lobby which was handy to refill empty expensive water bottles, and to chill drinks as there is no mini fridge in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, under whelming, good location”
Reviews.Author: RachDi
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here last week after a recommendation from the Amsterdam tourist board, Easy to find from the central train station, and well located for everything, the hotel itself is an old-fashioned disappointment. The lobby is bland, and the corridors are extremely out-dated. The rooms are TINY and very expensive for what you get. Our first room was on the 5th floor (509), but we asked to be moved because: the bathroom had hairs and dust all over it, the 'view' was of the (noisy) air-con units, half of the ceiling was covered in creeping damp, the air-con in our room was leaking on the carpet, it was so hot we had to keep the window open (despite freezing temperatures outside), and the 'double bed' was two singles pushed together... oh and the TV remote didn't work. Our second room (216) was cleaner and less damp, and had a view of the kitchen. It was less hot but more smelly. TV remote still didn't work! Had a double bed though. We slept well and there were no noises from other guests. Breakfast was average - lots of choice but not much quality, and not very healthy. Never saw the same staff on reception twice in three days, so felt very anonymous. Extremely expensive for what we got. No way is this a three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Use the safety deposit box unless you want to lose your sterling!”
Reviews.Author: StigWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Lovely weekend until morning of departure when one couple noticed their sterling Â£85.00 had been stolen. Reception were indifferent,the Police were most helpful. Another couple also had Â£30.00 stolen but didn't discover it in time to report it to the Police. Spoiled what had been a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: iannitch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Year trip to Amsterdam staying 3 nights at the Avenue Hotel. We were a party of 6 (3 couples). The Hotel is ideally located, close to many of the city's main attractions.We found it clean and fresh, with efficient,helpful staff and an excellent buffet breakfast. Two of our three rooms were smallish, but perfectly adequate. The third was big enough to host us all for pre or post outing drinks. On Trip Advisor's recommendation, we took Randy Roy's evening walking tour of the red light district, which was entertaining, informative and all conducted in the "Best possible taste!" I would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IN AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: BIGPLACE
Reviews.Content: We prebooked this Hotel prior to departure, and were very happy with the standard for the rate. We disembarked a River cruise ship and it was a short taxi ride to the Hotel. Rooms might be a bit small, but expected in an older hotel. Staff very attentive, breakfast good. Location fabulous, right near Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “Dull, cramped, but well located”
Reviews.Author: Fudge03
Reviews.Content: Got moved here from the hotel I'd actually booked at, so didn't arrive in the best of moods, but was calmed down by an efficient and swift check-in. This hotel is well located near to the station but away from the melee of the immediate station area. What really lets it down is the rooms - mine was so cramped I couldn't really walk round the bed from one side to the other - I had to sort of shuffle round it. The shower-room was so cramped that the door smacked into the loo every time you opened it, and the lighting was abysmal - a few dim wall-lights, one of which was not working. Breakfast better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireBonny Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was good. The staff on reception were very helpful. The hotel was clean and the room, although small, was very comfortable. We really enjoyed the breakfast. There was plenty of choice. Our only fault was the bathroom shower which ran over the floor. I would certainly use this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gj6
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a weekend staying at The Avenue Hotel, the location was great, easy to walk everywhere and right by the Central Station. The rooms were small but spotlessly clean with modern bathrooms. We had one issue with people partying in the room next door but one call to the night reception and they were quick to sort it out. Breakfast was good with lots of choice. Will definately stay here again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: EugeC
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel is a clean mid-sized hotel located a block from the InterContinental Hotel and on the same street as the public transport tram. Many attractions are within a 5-10 minute walk. Hallways and elevators are a bit compact, but the rooms are sized OK by European standards. Guests can enjoy a decent American breakfast included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and the best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSasa
Reviews.Content: This was the biggest and nicest room I stayed during my Europe trip. The whole place was just really nice and comfortable. The staff were very friendly. It's a short walk to the train station, which was really convenient. In fact we saw the whole city on foot, didn't even use the tram. It's close to most attractions (It was quiet a walk to the Van Gogh Museum though). The free breakfast there was the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean”
Reviews.Author: idsiatrip
Reviews.Content: I found human hair on the duvet on the bed. In the best case, this means that they are not very careful when they clean the room, in the worst case they did not change the sheets. The single room was very small, and the carpet (not immaculate) was heavily stained. The corridors were somehow dilapidated. The hotel is centrally located, but it is also rather noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Spadam
Reviews.Content: We stepped off the train with no hotel booked, and planned on just walking around a bit and finding one in a good location with decent rates. The Avenue Hotel was perfect for our needs. The front desk staff were very helpful booking us into a double room on the fourth floor. The room was a bit small, but when in Amsterdam, why stay in your room all day? The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was small but usable, and the air conditioning kept the room comfortable at all times. When we checked in, the staff mentioned breakfast. We thought it would be some cereal, fruit, and coffee. To our surprise that first morning, the spread was incredible. Fresh bread with lots of cold cuts, hot bacon, cereal, fruit, juices, and much more was available. This breakfast was excellent and saved us a lot of money! The location is also ideal. It is about 5 minutes from central station, and 2 minutes from the main walking/shopping path. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: orik13
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed in a quadruple room (it's actually two rooms). Rooms are not big, but they are very suitable for a family traveling with 2 kids. Hotel is located very close to Dam square (about 5min walking). There are many good restaurants in its area. Breakfast are very good in the hotel itself. Just their coffee. All except coffee is good there.

Reviews.Title: “We were well chuffed when we saw our room”
Reviews.Author: fatbarman
Reviews.Content: As the title says, we had a great room number 98 just behind the small bar in the foyer. Nice and big on the ground floor with two great big windows ! so tempted to earn some money lol. We had a great couple of days at this hotel. Good location, Food (breakfast ok) Staff were very helpful with maps and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Single Room means small”
Reviews.Author: helen13Houston_Texas
Reviews.Content: I'd never been in such a small hotel room! Closet was tiny and there was no chest of drawers--lived 3 days out of my suitcase. All the necessities are there, though, good lighting, desk space, tv (actually too large for the room size) comfortable-enough (narrow) twin bed, great internet connection, modern bathroom--also very small, but well lit. Room was clean except for the stained carpet. Heating/cooling very good and the window had a good view of the street. Area quiet especially considering location--just down the street from Central Station. Most of the reception desk staff were very knowledgeable about dirctions to places and very helpful. Cheap eating places and small markets in the area and easy to get to the major shopping street close by. Breakfast was included and was buffet-style, all you could eat. Cool thing at the hotel: you could have guests join you in a very comfortable seating area just off the reception area. Tables, chairs, restrooms, ice and water available and outside food and drinks could be brought in.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: lantNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: The location was good. The breakfast was good. The room was clean if a little small but we expected that and it was no problem!

Reviews.Title: “ridiculously convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fitubolla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights while attending a conference. Took the train from the airport, and walked from the train station to the hotel. It really is as central as everyone says. Several trams stop right outside the door. Two minutes walk to the biggest shopping street and the canals are right around the corner. My room was a nice, clean double room on the 6th floor. So no disturbances from outside (I kept the window open all the time), but I can not say how it is to have a room closer to ground level. The room was clean and functional, nothing fancy but nothing fancy needed. Free wireless internet. Breakfast included (again, nothing fancy but still a nice buffee with something for most people). The service was nice, the ladies in the front desk were helpful with free maps and tips on what to see. Arrived quite early in the day but they still found me a room to check into right away. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yezadm
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel.......courteous staff...great breakfast....best advantage about it is the location...very close to all major tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “WOW! WHAT A GREAT SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: WeGottaTravelOn
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this charming hotel thru a budget travel deal. Needless to say, we had no idea what to expect. We took the train from the airport, (as recommended by a review on Travel Advisor). It is the cheapest, & most fun way to get to the city center from the airport-not to mention easy! The walk is maybe 10 minutes at the most from the train station to the hotel. Upon ariving we were pleasently surprised at how nice the place was. It is located within walking distance from almost everything. The lobby is charming as well as the staff. Now the elevator is tiny but it never was an issue. The rooms are not huge, but rooms in Europe are not huge. We never stay in the super fancy hotels but a good, clean average priced hotel is for sleeping in not living in. There were 3 couples in our group & all 3 rooms were super clean. Something I found nice is that the windows opened. So if you like freash air that's a plus. They also have a free breakfest buffet. Not 5 star but everything you could want - hot & cold. We ate there everyday & were very pleased. There is even a coffee machine in the lobby if you need a pick-me-up 24/7. Dozens of food choices, gift shops, coffee shops & bars are a short walk from the front door. Amsterdam is a very easy city to get around in (just find the train station & you'll find your home base). This hotel made it a breeze to have a totally relaxing vacation. For anyone who wants a nice, clean, friendly place to stay, I HIGHLY recommend the Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “you could do better”
Reviews.Author: mikes66682
Reviews.Content: The rooms are reminiscent of prison cells where size is concerned. Though there are elevators, if you're on one of the last two floors you find yourself having to take 2 different elevators to avoid dragging your luggage up/down stairs. The hotel claims to be smoke-free, but they don't really enforce it. The breakfast could be much better, i.e. I wouldn't feed those breakfast sausages to a starving dog. They don't have fridges in the rooms, or safes either, and to use the safe at reception they demand 3 euros per day, which most 3-star hotels DON'T do. You could probably do better elsewhere while staying in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1234
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hotel. We had two twin rooms, the one i stayed in was quite small but was clean and tidy. Breakfast room and Bedrooms did get warm but this was because Air Conditioning is not working - when its back up and running it should be better. Breakfast was fine, no complaints from any of us. Had no problems with staff, we left our luggage at hotel until we could check in and left it there after we checked out . The location is great , just a few minutes walk from Central Station and to Dam Square. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visitor Can't REcommend Enough”
Reviews.Author: Jtisdale
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this Hotel 6 times in the past two years and cannot say enough about it for what it is. For a 3 star hotel and its price, it is amazing. The location is the finest for Amsterdam. I typically take the train from the airport at 3.60 euros one way and save a very expensive cab fare. Cross the street from the station and 2.5 blocks and you're at the front door. Dutch blocks are about 50 feet long, so it's a breeze. Ditto for return or early a.m. departures to airport. Rooms, expecially singles are small. Singles are really tiny, but my rooms have always been fanatically clean. I took my sister for her birthday from NYC and another time with a friend and a couple trips by myself. Breakfast is an adequate array of simple foods and a bit more choices than some others on the european plan. WIndows that open, the price, always hot water, very clean and the location can't be beaten. I'm even going again in Jan/Feb with friends who are meeting me there . They just installed new air conditioning which should be up and running in the spring. It can get too hot from the heat in the winter, but all over eurpoe this is the norm and baffles us Americans, especially when they [-] about the fuel cost, yet leave the shop doors open all day and nite too. I stay here every chance I get. Tram is out front, restaurants, coffee houses, bars within 150 feet. Humphreys has a prix fix menu on the tiny sq. next door at about 21 euros with 3 courses and is pretty good, certainly better than standard tourist restaurants and some dutch dishes, cheeses and desserts. Also Hjaes Claes on Spui and ten blocks or so down has exceppent dutch food choices and the locals go there too. Been there several times and it is great. Double check the spelling on that. Also American Cafe at American Hotel on Leidseplein has a fine cafe/bistro menu, extremely well done, seasonal specialties, but pretty expensive. Yet they deliver and beat the tourist crap at the tourist places. For the people who [-], pay twice as much at am American name chain and be dissappointed. They'll never beat the location, cleanliness, free internet or anything else I can imagine. I've tried those and feel deflated, expecially over the money and they want 15 -29 euros for the same breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for family”
Reviews.Author: idish
