Reviews.Content: Quad room great for family of 4 - has a double bed and a loft with two single beds. Kids were happy to be up in the loft / attic. Good location, convinient public transport. Nice breakfast. Free wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ellerslieboy
Reviews.Content: An easy walk from the main station makes this a great location. Staff were welcoming and helpful. The rooms are comfortable, if not luxurious. We slept well and internet was easy. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby and Amsterdam's main sites are all walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Avenue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebartlett
Reviews.Content: I was worried as a US traveler staying outside the international chains in a place that definitely appeared smaller than a hotel room I was used to. The location of this place was great, it was easy to get to from Central Station. We took the train from the airport and walked (about 5 minutes) with our bags to the hotel. We were greeted with a great staff, especially Sebastian (hopefully I spelled that right) who were friendly about offering tips for the city. There is a yellow bike store to rent bikes from right next door so we had an easy time getting around. We stayed in Hilton (Prague, Munich, and the one at the airport in Amsterdam) hotels the rest of our trip and we both preferred this hotel. The carpet did have a few spots but overall cleanliness was pretty good. I was also worried about no AC in the rooms but as the temperature was mid-70's all day and great at night we didn't notice it. The hotel was currently under renovation to add AC so that would be a plus. The renovation was loud but concentrated during the day when we weren't in are room for more than a few minutes to grab something. Overall a great atmosphere to experience a great city.

Reviews.Title: “trip”
Reviews.Author: bathia
Reviews.Content: very central and clean but small room very stuffy due to air conditioning not working, breakfast good and staff very helpful very clean

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Buttercup
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Avenue Hotel at the end of July for only one night as I had to switch planes coming back home to Toronto. I found this hotel over the Internet and looked at the hotel site before booking. I decided to go with Avenue because it was very close to the Central station and it offered an early morning shuttle bus service to the airport for 12 euros which was very convenient. However, once I got there I realized the website and the lobby of the hotel were very deceiving. The room I stayed in was very poorly kept. The carpet was dirty, the bed small and uncomfortable and didn't look very clean. It was very hot, the AC wasn't working and I had to keep the window open all night just to get some air in. I wasn't too happy with the bathroom either. Comparing to the other hotels I've stayed in Europe, it was quite dirty. Also, another warning: The walls are VERY thin and the noise is unbearable. The people next door were not talking very loudly, but it felt like they were sitting in the room with me. Horrible! I wouldn't recommend this hotel as there are other much better hotels in Amsterdam for the same price. The only good thing about Avenue that it is very close to the Central station (less than a 5 minute walk) and to the Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID ! pay a little extra for quality!”
Reviews.Author: ukdeejay
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel to be told check in was 2pm, it was now 1.30pm so I waited and waited, I was eventually allowed to check in at almost 3pm! The single rooms are so small like a broom cupboard; they have a shower with a hole in the bathroom floor, so every time you shower the whole en-suite room floods! When booking the hotel I requested a single room with a bath 4 months in advance, which I had stayed in before, I received no reply to this and my request was NOT honoured. Breakfast food was only warm and not worth bothering with, the hotel staff donâ€™t seem to care very much about your comments. The only good point of this hotel is its location and it is cheaper than most. I would NOT stay again! My advice is to pay a little extra and have some comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - again!”
Reviews.Author: PeterNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to this hotel in the last 12 months and for those who aren't after luxuries associated with more expensive hotels, I can definitely recommend the Avenue. I stayed here for 3 nights in a single room on the top (6th) floor and had a peaceful sleep each night. Some traffic noise which is expected but no mosquitos, perfect. The room was small and basic but spotlessly clean and the walk in shower (no bath) was excellent. Breakfast was adequate with a selection of hot and cold food. As previously stated this hotel is in an excellent location. My main reason for this trip to Amsterdam was a Steve Lukather concert at the Paradiso (Leidseplein) which was a cheap 1.60 euro ride via trams 1, 2 or 5 which also go to the DAM, Flower Market etc. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear-plugs and a steam cleaner!”
Reviews.Author: Teuchter_Quine
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Amsterdam having stayed in the Avenue Hotel, the hotel location was great just the next street from Dam Square (which itself was a big disappointment for the major square in the city). However room 202 should be avoided! Although the room was small it was adequate, cable tv with BBC channels to keep up to date with news etc, but we had a note saying the air conditioning unit wasnâ€™t working â€“ there wasnâ€™t even a unit in the bedroom so it couldnâ€™t have worked! We had to keep the window open but there was a problem - it opened directly onto the kitchen roof and there was an extractor fan/generator on its roof (see photo) which was on 24hrs a day so you either had to close the window and sweat or leave it open and try and sleep with the noise. The carpet was appalling obviously someone had been sick on it as you could still see the stain and all over it there were black stains you had to keep something on your feet all the time. The bathroom was more like a wet room as the shower didnâ€™t have a tray so water went all over the floor even up to base of the toilet, tip take a pair of flip flops with you and wear them all the time. There wasnâ€™t any point of asking for another room as there obviously couldnâ€™t have been another one available as you wouldnâ€™t have put paying guests into 202 if you had another one available in the first place! Breakfast was ok cereals, fruit, coffee, tea but no hot chocolate, there was also bacon etc although didnâ€™t have so cant say if it was ok. As for the staff, well we treat people the way we would like to be treated ourselves so when we arrived we said hello, smiled and were pleasant only to be met with a very straight faced guy who gave us forms to fill in with our details etc and then said ok you are in room 202 and that was it. Went back later to reception and asked if we could have a safety box he gave us two keys and explained what they were for I offered to pay but he said it would be added to our bill that was all he said. On the day we were leaving we went to the safety box only to find my passport missing so immediately went to reception and explained what had happened and said I would need to contact the British Consul to which the receptionist said â€˜whyâ€™ I explained I would need a replacement passport, just then one of her colleagues (who had seen us the previous day) arrived she said there was passport under the counter sure enough it was my passport (some honest person had found it on the floor and handed it into reception) but it had my room number on it and had been there since we arrived - no one from reception had bothered to tell us!! I said â€˜thank youâ€™ as I very, very grateful although still donâ€™t know how it came to be on the floor. We handed over our safety box keys only for the receptionist to say â€˜we have been looking for these you should have handed them backâ€™ - no one had told us we had to! Every time you came into the hotel the receptionist had to press a button to let you in â€“ very good security but they never acknowledged you even although we always smiled and said â€˜helloâ€™ so they had plenty of opportunity to let me know where my passport was! Can recommend Anne Frankâ€™s house and the flower market but take a good map as sign posts are few can also recommend La Madonna Italian restaurant in Nieuwendijk 33 lovely meal and waiters!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ecp07pks
Reviews.Content: Looking at the previous review, i have to say that i dont really agree. The hotel is in a great location on a main street with a tram stop only 1 minute walk away. The staff were very friendly and the reception area was very nice. Our room was not as grand and rather small due to a box in the corner (see photo) however we had everything we needed, it was clean and tidy, and we had a double bed rather than 2 singles, we had free wireless internet and a tv with the BBC on it. The air conditioning was not working however we had very large windows in our room which made up for it. Breakfast consisted of an array of options including white an brown bread, croissants, mini pancakes, fruit salad, 4 different cereals, eggs, sausages, ham, cheese, loads of preserves, yoghurt, juice and other hot beverages! Someone came evryday to replace the towels and do the bed however in between our stay their cleaning was not to a standard as high as when we first came. All in all it was a great stay for a young couple, could do with being slightly cheaper, however apart from this i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Avenue was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SonaG
Reviews.Content: As a single female leisure traveller from India, I was concerned about booking good hotel rooms for myself when I travelled to some European cities. I found Avenue on Venere.com.....everything about it on the website coupled with the reviews on this site made me book a single room for myself for 2 nights in May 2008. On reaching Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, I very easily got myself onto the train that got me to Amsterdam Central in no time. As instructed very cleraly on the website, the hotel is just a 5 minute walk away from the station..which proved to be very convenient. The man at the reception was very friendly and welcomed me though I reached there as early asa 8:00am!!! I was requested to leave my bags in the luggage room and come back later in the afternoon. After going about the city in the canal bus (hop on hop off), I returned to the hotel later in the afternoon and was delighted with the single room I was given. It was on the 4th floor...had no view (but that's ok)....it was very comfortable, had a lovely bath and a bright cheerful feel to it. The location is perfect....all the places of interest are within walking distance. The breakfast which was included in the price was wonderful....breads, jellies, cereals, milk, juices, eggs, pancakes......didn't feel hungry until much later in the day after eating breakfast like a king! I enjoyed an Italian meal just across the road from the hotel...regret that I don't remember the name of the restaurant. All in all, I had a wonderful 2 night stay at Hotel Avenue before I left for Belgium and France. I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: honest_gerry
Reviews.Content: Me and 3 lads stayed at the Avenue Hotel from Fri 30th May 08 - Mon 2nd June 08. I booked a quad room (4 single beds). See their website for pictures as the photos of the rooms are as they say. The room itself was great. Only two small things that posed a problem. 1. There is a step before you enter the toilet. Not good when you are drunk! lol 2. The ceiling frame is low at some points in the room, especially near the window. We bumped our heads several times. Takes getting used to. There is a safety deposit box for your money and passport. This is in the reception area. Just ask the receptionist for a key. Its 2,50 eur a day. If your flight is late and you have checked out of the hotel, there is a luggage room to leave your bags in so you can go shopping or get something to eat before the airport. This was great because we had booked our flight for 10pm on the monday night and all hotels check you out at 12am. A lot of people give the breakfast two thumbs up on this website. I disagree as we found the sausages to be uncooked and not eatable. The bacon was rawish (dutch style). You could get a bowl of cereal and some bread and orange juice but dont be expecting a massive selection. The breakfast is included in your price. We played loud music and had the craic in our room before we went out. We had no complaints which was great. Our view was of brick wall which didnt bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing room : (”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsausage
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel is situated right in the center of Amsterdam so is easy to find and a brilliant location. The outside and lobby area give you a false impression that the rooms are going to be just as nice but I was quite disappointed : ( The room and decor looked very tired and the carpet could do with a good steam clean, the bedding could also do with replacing as that too looked old, we took the covers off the quilts (it was so hot in our room - air-con not yet working - we couldn't cope with heavy quilts) and found them grubby and stained. The bathroom was OK, could have done with a makeover but the room did seem clean though. Anyhow, as we were only sleeping there it wasn't too much of a problem. The breakfast was brilliant! Loads to choose from and all delicious (I must admit I made several trips to the self-service buffet and I recommend the small pancakes and maple syrup!). The hotel is near the Red Light District (but don't let that put you off as it was unobtrusive, fascinating and looked quite pretty at night with the red lights on!). Amsterdam is such a beautiful city, I love, love, love it!! There is so much to see and do and it is a great place for people watching, I can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little all-rounder!”
Reviews.Author: mad_for_travel_8
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel was a great choice for a weekend break to Amsterdam. A train from Schiphol airport whisked us to Centraal Station in no time and ten mins walk had us at the Avenue Hotel, ideally located on Noord-Holland.The staff were friendly, courteous and all spoke English. When we had a problem with our original room - three rooms were under renovation on our floor - they quickly moved us to another room on a different floor. The breakfast buffet was outstanding - varied and expansive - and kept us going for a good part of the day. Most of the city's must-see destinations are within walking distance, including Dam Square, The Anne Frank House and the Red Light District. I was one of a hen party of 23 and we could not fault it for location, value for money and customer service. I would recommend it to anyone considering a trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gillc26
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend staying at the Avenue Hotel. The Hotel was excellent for a 3* accomodation. The twin room was perfectly adequate with a lovely bathroom. We stayed in room 111 on the 1st floor, so there was a little noise from outside in the evening, but no noise from people walking to and from their rooms. Security was excellent as you needed your key card to access the lift to go to your room. Breakfast was included in the room price and was excellent - choice of cereals, cooked breakfast, continental and fruit. Nothing ever ran out and all the tables were kept clean. We would stay again xxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: Phylgina
Reviews.Content: This hotel was somewhat disapointing. The room was small, but the bathroom was large for European standards and clean. The room had 1 small window that was too high to even see out of, so it made the room seem somewhat dungoness. The breakfast was ok, but I've had better. The staff tried to be helpful, but they were not very knowedgable about things we needed help with. The location of the hotel was convenient, being very close to the train station and there were a few restaurants close by. However, traveling with just another female friend, I did feel a little uneasy after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service and love the room”
Reviews.Author: eveline77
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed @ a quad room in this hotel. It was very roomy and the rest of my friends that stayed at their double rooms are happy with the hotel also. The location is excellent, its very close to the central station. Its at the borderline of red light district so we have the benefit of both world. It was quiet and yet we are in the middle of everything. The front desk people were GREAT!! They made our trip so much more pleasant after the hotel expereince in Paris. They are so much more friendly and very helpful. The front desk staff made some restaurant recommendations and we loved it!! Both the price and the quality of the food were excellent. The restaurants were right by their hotel too! I know they are currently undergoing some sort of constructions so the hotel will probably be even better! I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: juzzy_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we expected and more! Literally a few minutes walk to EVERYTHING in Amsterdam from Dam Square, to the red light district, to Anne Frank's House and of course central station. The room was small (but what rooms in Europe are'nt) but made the most of space. Was very clean, very comfortable and quiet. We had a room at the back, which did'nt have a view (honestly who cares it's where you sleep) but did have a small bathroom, but of course it did'nt bother us as it was spotlessly clean! Brekafast was more then adequate with a great spread to suit everybody. Staff were helpful and you could even leave your bags in the luggage room while you explore the city waiting until you could get into the room. Considering it's Amsterdam, the price was fair. Would reccommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value, would go back”
Reviews.Author: Nicks_gal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. It is only a 5 minute walk from centraal train station and is right in the centre of Amsterdam. Our check in was very quick and efficient and the reception staff were courrteous and helpful throughout the stay. This hotel is great for a short break, it is spotlessly clean and the rooms are modern and comfortable. We paid about Â£75 per night and i think this was quite good value for bed and breakfast. It's difficult to get cheap beds in Amsterdam, so this was fine. I would recommend it and would definately return. It's no frills but pleasant and comfortable. I asked for a room at the back after reading other reviews and it was a little noisy at times during the night, but nothing to complain about. The standard/decor of room was similar to the standard of a travelodge/travel inn type place in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: nokkla
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel was our perfect 'home' in the heart of Amsterdam for our 8 day holiday. Perfect to relax between a day roaming and shopping and for getting ready for an evening of fun. We asked for a bath and a smkoing room. We got the bath, but everybody seems to be smoking in the hotel so we (and they) did not bother and kept our room. It does not mean the hotel was a smelly smkoing hotel, just that the distinction between smoking and not is inexistent as almost evrywhere in Amsterdam. The service was impeccable, the central heating was great (almost too hot). We had a rooom on the side of the hotel. No view but very quite at night for a good night's rest. The hotel was cosy, buffet breakfast was truly filling. There is also a pub which we never visited. I would suggest it very much to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Quite, mostly with business people and especially very central! Just 5 minutes walk from Dam Square. Tram stop just opposite the road.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: clicheguevara
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel is rated between three and four stars, depending on where you look, but the more reputable websites seem to tend towrads giving it three stars. With this in mind, and my previous experience of so called three star hotels in Amsterdam, I wasn't expecting much. When I arrived in Amsterdam at Central Station, I was pleasantly suprised by ow close the hotel was, it was no more than a three minute walk from the front of the station. Easy to find too, as the building is a distinctive colour on that street. Upon entering, I was impressed by the reception, which was large, clean and tasteful. The friendly guy at the desk informed us that our room wouldn't be ready for an hour, which was slightly disappointing, but he pointed out the left luggage room for us, so we dropped our suitcases off and went to explore. When we came back, we were given our keycard very quickly, and pointed in the direction of the lift. Our room was on the fourth floor, but because of the lift this didn't matter. The room was not of a huge size, but did make good use of the space. The "queen bed" turned out to be two singles pushed together, but on the plus side that did mean it was bigger than the average double. The sheets were all very clean. There was a decent sized wardrobe, a huge desk/dressing mirror, a small TV, another large dressing mirror and plenty of lighting. The window was big, but the view was terrible, just of a brick wall. Good job we didn't plan to spend too much time in the room, and this did also mean that our room was very quiet. The bathroom was of a good size, with a lovely deep bath and nice clean towels. There were two shower heads, one on the wall and one attached to the bath, neither of which would maintain a constant temperature long enough for a comfortable shower, so we resorted to having baths instead. All in all, although there were a couple of small problems (the shower, the single beds and the view), none of these really seemed to matter, because the hotel was clean and spacious, quiet, and the staff were always willing to help. To top it all off, the hotel is in a fantastic location, just on the outside of the main pedestrianised shopping area, very close to the station and dam square, and not too far (or close!) to the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shirbaz
Reviews.Content: There was 7 of us who stayed at the Avenue Hotel, we found the hotel to be very central, clean and great for visiting the sites of Amsterdam. Our room was of average size, however the bathroom was pretty small. The down side of the room was that it overlooked the front of the hotel and it was very very noisy, also we had the hotel sign outside of the window which meant the room being very brigth even during the night with the blackout curtains drawn. The breakfast at the hotel is excellant with plenty of choice and variety. The hotel has a little bar which we used only the once. The hotel is really central, its an excellent location for the main shopping area and just a short walk from most of the interesting sites around Amsterdam. I would return to this hotel, however I wpould have to insist on a room at the back of the hotel (my fellow travellers had these and slept like a log) other than that its a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “City Convenience”
Reviews.Author: DINKEtravellers
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as a lay over on our way home. The avenue is about a ten minute walk from the station and allowed us to leave our luggage all day so that we could go round the city long before we could check in. It is within 5 minutes of Dam square and really well placed on one of the main tram routes. The rooms were small but clean and all of the staff really friendly. bar prices were very reasonable for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: whooshYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in this hotel 4 years ago and enjoyed our stay. Because the location was good we thought we would try it again, and were happy to see the same standard was there, very good value for a 3 star.The rooms are very clean and the bathroom spotless, beds were comfy we both slept well. The staff are helpful and courteous and the food at breakfast was to a good standard and plentiful. If you are coming to Amsterdam for a short break we would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: toris27
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful! - Great location..can walk straight from centraal station to hotel. - Short walk to shops, cafes, restaurants, tourist attractions. - Staff friendly and helpful - Extremely clean - Rooms perfect I loved it. 2 of us stayed for a few nights this summer. Great for young people. We are college students. Very quiet in hotel (I hope we weren't the loud ones!) Only thing I could possible see that people would complain about is that the shower was one of those "the whole bathroom is the shower" things. It just had a curtain around it and it tended to get very wet in the bathroom. However, it did not bother me one bit! The room also had a full length mirror. BONUS for girls getting ready to go out at night!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: haviland12
Reviews.Content: Great location just outside the Red Light District. Staff are friendly and helpful. Onsite pub has great prices and the free hot breakfast buffet is excellent. Rooms are clean but small and include all amenities. The hotel is also very close to the train station and all Amsterdam attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wardrobe
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam. We stayed in the Avenue hotel on Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal right in the centre of town. It's a five minute walk from Centraal Station and between 10-30 minutes walk to virtually anywhere in the city. In fact we didn't travel on the trams/metro once as everything was so close by! We went to over there to shop and the two main shopping streets Kalverstraat and Nieuwendijk are literally round the corner. Fantastic! The hotel is on a busy street but we had a room facing the courtyard (number 305) so it was quiet. Double glazing as well. The room was functional and clean. We didn't have a bath but the water was hot and the shower good. The towels were nice. The room wasn't big but then again we only slept in there so we didn't need a lot of space. There were the beds, a table and two chairs, a full lenght mirror and a TV. The TV had all the usual suspects, BBC News 24, BBC Prime, CNN, plus local Dutch and German channels. The staff were ever so friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is really really good, fantastic choice of breads, meats, cheese, fruit, cereals and hot breakfast like sausages and bacon. Plus coffee, tea and fruitjuices. I've stayd in Lisbon (****) and Vienna (***) lately and this buffet beats both hands down. The hotel is quite safe as well as you need the room keycard to get into the lift from reception and the breakfast room. Plus there is someone in reception 24/7. On the other side of the street from the hotel there is an English Pub, Turkish, Mexican and Italian restaurants plus loads of other restaurants nearby that we didn't have a chance to visit. The Turkish restaurant Ankara has great food, as does the Italian. Plus there is little supermarkets for essentials like soft drinks & snacks right opposite the hotel as well. There is a traditional Dutch restaurant called Oud Holland down the road on the same side of the street at Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 105 as well, the hotel is number 33. So all in all a great little hotel, great location and friendly staff. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Shamelesness”
Reviews.Author: cabulero
Reviews.Content: 5 months after check out they try to charge the double amount in my credit card. They're not professional staff at all. My stay was more or less pleasant, I don't really remember very much, but it's incredible this shamelessness. A hotel service like that should be prohibited! Please, never go to this hotel if you don't want to be ripped off..who knows how long after...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dreary”
Reviews.Author: Scottish8traveller
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The hotel really needs a refurb. I stayed in the quad room with my husband and two children. All beds are singles and the room was very smelly and dusty. Also very noisy to the front. The beds were small and uncomfy and the towels almost threadbare and had the filthiest carpet I have seen. If it was half the price, I'd think it was fair, but overall it was really bad value. True it is central but not a nice area for families. Ideal for a stag night perhaps. Shame because the the room itself could have had character. Also lots of dodgy guys in the hotel and the luggage room has a stack of x-rated movies piled up, just at the right height for an 8 year old. Also, beware families, my daughter fell down the stepladder and broke her arm. Reception were not rude, but really didn't care. We had just completed a wonderful cycling holiday (Cycletours) and the Avenue experience really spoilt it for us. Don't understand why other reviewers say the lobby is nice. I travel a lot and it is a very very average. Regret wasting my money on this hotel. You can defintely do better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: smerritt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and the location was ideal for us. An easy drag of the bags from the Centraal Station to the hotel. It's within walking distance to most everythig, very central, but not in an area that's overly crammed with tourists. You can get where you're going, but it was nice to be able to return to the hotel being in a calmer area. Of course there's plenty of shopping, cafes and restaurants a block or two away. We had a room with a window that opened up into a central air shaft type void above the breakfast area. It was necessary in the summer to have the window open or else you'd melt, but with the window open you got to hear crying babies, drunk people yelling into their mobile phones at the window and all the while smoke wafting into your room from others. Overall the place was clean, the rooms were alright, the location was great but it was difficult to sleep at times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, staff not nice.”
Reviews.Author: travelingontheedge
Reviews.Content: Avenue Hotel is in a great location and the lobby looks very nice. The staff is extremely rude if you want to ask them a question. They act like you are bothering them. The room have a very small bathroom and NO air conditioner. If you go in the summer, you should ask for a fan at the front desk. I have been to Amsterdam on several times, but I will never stay at the Avenue Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Avenue- great bargain, great location”
Reviews.Author: robmm22
Reviews.Content: This review is a little dated- i stayed at the Avenue Hotel in April of 2005... After a long search for the right hotel, I decided to book the Avenue Hotel for a 5 night stay in Amsterdam. I have been to the city previously, but stayed in a hotel far outside the central district. This time around i was looking to be closer to the action. The Avenue offered very reasonable rates in a good location. This is the perfect hotel for those looking to see Amsterdam on a budget, but do not want to deal with the hostels. it's a clean, modern hotel in a good spot. If you're looking for a 4 star luxury hotel, this isnt your place. A short walk from the train station, the hotel is in a central spot for walking the city. Restaurants, bars, cafes, museums and shops are all within walking distance.. we had no need for trains or cabs for our entire stay. The rooms are typically European - clean, but very small. Our bed was at best a double size (definitely not a queen) but my girlfriend and i got used to sleeping in it after a night. The bathroom was modern, and the room was kept very clean by staff. We had no issues with any noise- but since we were in the back of the hotel, i cannot comment on the front rooms. The included breakfast buffet standard, and a good way to save a few $$$.. the typical scones, muffins, eggs, teas and coffees were offered... if you get tired of the same old, try one of the breakfast cafes on the block.. there's one right up the road run by a woman from Seattle.. she was friendly and the food was great. The hotel also features a small lounge/bar area with internet connection. You have to buy internet access to use the computer. The connection (as of 2005) was very slow, and generally not worth using if you could avoid it. The bar area was generally not crowded, and closed before midnight every night. Overall, I was extremely happy with my choice of the Avenue. I wasn't staying in Amsterdam to hangout in my hotel, so all i wanted was location, value, and cleanliness. With the Avenue, you go 3 for 3.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run Hotel near Everything”
Reviews.Author: NJGardenerHoboken
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Avenue because of its location near the train station and a particular business location (trip was a mix of business and vacation), While it's quite near the train station, in a busy area, and near the 'red light' district, I found it to be very nice and professionally run. (However, I did walk around the red light district to get to my place of business.) I would recommend it. I didn't find it to be noisy at all, despite it's location, though I think this could be an issue on some nights. The room was quite large for Europe, with a full bathtub. The breakfast was great. The staff is well trained and helpful without acting like they're your new best friends (that overly friendly American way so popular in the hospitality industry).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, a little dreary”
Reviews.Author: Hannahsmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue for 2 nights. The room was rather small but with a good size bathroom. Very dark as very little natural light and no main light in the room. Bed was very comfy. The hotel was in a great location a few minutes walk from the Centraal Station. most things in walking distance. Receptionists were very aloof and quite unfriendly. I would imagine them to be very at home in a 5 star ultra luxury hotel, as they walked around with their noses in the air! All in all a good stay and the breakfast was OK too.

Reviews.Title: “The Avenue Hotel---Great as always”
Reviews.Author: TravelPROotown
Reviews.Content: As this was our 3rd stay at the Avenue, it was great to see that nothing has changed. The rooms are very nice, and roomy. As always, the breah\kfast is truely exceptional. So much to offer ! Location is very good for most of what Amsterdam has to offer. Again, the staff is very helpful. Some of the same staff have worked there for years, and I recognized them from a last visit.

Reviews.Title: “fab rooms, ace location, smashing holiday”
Reviews.Author: xstacey
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say , it had been many years since I had visited amsterdam so I was very keen to make sure that all elements of the holiday went well. The location is ideal for the central, station, dam square, a cafe is located across the roads numerous shops nearby and also the tram stops. There is no need to get on the tram from central station to the hotel just walk. (it took me and my partner 5 mins ) he was carrying the case though....... The room that we had was huge and cleaned daily. I had no issue at all with the accomodation the staff are very friendly. The sweets on the reception are even better . My only gripe was the breakfast !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! did not enjoy at all , it is still edible but it just was not worth waking up for in the morning. There is a wide selection to choose from but i mainly stuck to doing myself sandwichs with the wide selection of cheese and ham you got . All in all fantastic. This is a hotel that i would def use again.

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: krazykel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from a 5 night stay at Avenue Hotel. The room was basic but comfortable with all we needed as a base, the room was very clean which is always a plus. The only downside was that we had nothing at all to look at out the window but who goes to Amsterdam to stay in their room! We made it to breakfast a couple times it was good plenty of choice of hot and cold options lots of coffee, tea and fresh fruit juice. The location of this hotel is spot on with it being close enough to all sights etc but also far enough away so it wasnt too noisy. We really enjoyed our time in Amsterdam and would definatly stay at Avenue Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy here”
Reviews.Author: shoemanEngland
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) wanted somewhere to stay for 4 days for my 60th birthday. The Avenue was recommended by a local travel agent, so I checked out the comments on Tripadvisor then returned and booked it. Staff were very friendly, polite and helpful with queries and questions. The Hotel is owned by a group which has other Amsterdam Hotels also and whilst there is no restaurant on site, a complimentary ticket for one in one of their other nearby hotels (2 minutes walk towards the Railway Station away), giving a ten percent discount on meals, is part of the welcome pack in the rooms. There is a bar on site open 5pm to midnight daily where we were able to buy Bombay Sapphire gin and bottles of tonic, a double cost 10 Euros (for her indoors, who didn't want to try the local gin - Jenever). Pizzas can be ordered in the bar but as the streets all around are brimming with cafes, take aways, restaurants etc, we didn't try this service. I settled for a "medium" glass of Heineken at 2.50 Euros! My travel agent told us that only "Continental" breakfasts were served in the hotel. Continental breakfasts have changed since I was a lad! This used to mean a croissant and a cup of coffee but breakfast catered for all nationalities with a help yourself choice of: 4 cereals, fruits in syrup, a great bowl of yoghurt, croissants, hard boiled eggs, hot scrambled eggs, bacon, beans, frankfurter sausages, tomatoes, a choice of salads and cold meats, grapefruit juice, orange juice, cold milk, piping hot coffee, hot milk, tea, marmalades, jams, bread rolls etc etc. We ate until full and didn't need to eat again until evening, and we used up a lot of energy walking all over the city! There is enough food at breakfast to make up packed lunches if you so desired without denting the constantly re-filled dish quantities. The only negative I could give was that one of the two showers (yes, TWO) over the bath was badly set so her indoors flooded the bathroom floor in spite of having pulled the curtain round as far as possible, (AND tucked it inside the bath) and soaked the floor towel rather extensively! Another small problem we encountered was that we struggled to turn the lights on in our room and to re-open the door once we'd got in until I figured out that the credit card key had to be put in to a small slot alongside the light switches by the door, after which everything worked fine. (We'd not come across this system before).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, well priced”
Reviews.Author: sonicUk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 occasions in the past 12 months and have had a different room each time. The rooms at the top of the hotel are the best, with views over the city rooftops. All rooms are clean and newly decorated, if a little small but that is typical for Amsterdam. The location is good - only 5 minutes walk from the central station, and close to the main attractions such as the Jordan. Prices are about average for Amsterdam, but I have stayed in worse hotels in the city for the same price. Breakfast is OK, but there are numerous cafe's nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: patricia-7
Reviews.Content: We must have chosen the coldest days in March for a break at "The Avenue". Despite the weather we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very convenient for all the sights and transport , being a short walk from the station and the canal bus. The hotel was friendly and very clean and comfortable. The breakfast's were just great with lots of choice. The room was always very warm which we were very grateful for as it was so cold outside. We would definately go back there when we visit Amsterdam again. I left a small item of clothing in the room and they returned this to me without any problems. Thank-you "The Avenue"

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayney456
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the avenue for 5 nghts in march,and we were really pleased when we arrived,it was cosy and welcoming,and the staff really helpful on reception. having made it to our room (we are both smokers and requested a smoking room)were really pleased that our room was clean and tidy,and even though a smoking room not stinky at all.the room was adequate for 2 people,as we only used it for a base.it was very cold and windy the whole time we stayed in dam,and found the room a bit chilly at times,but hey,a good excuse to snuggle up!! we were amazed that we didnt hear any noise(at all) in rooms,really solid walls. if you like a morning cuppa remember a travel kettle,but its not a huge problem as there is a douwe egberts coffee/tea machine in the lobby.breakfast was good,you could really fill up with cereals,the usual "hotel" streaky bacon,srambled eggs and beans etc,then have bread/rolls with jam etc. we had a late breakfast one morning and even thogh it was edible,could have been a bit hotter,but not a problem either as there were plenty of other things on offer. overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay,and will definately stay here again,(just not for a while,need some time to recover!!!) really good situation too,10mins from centraal station ,and 10 mins to dam sq,depending on how many coffeeshops you pass along the way!!perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BonzoDevon
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive as we arrived at the Avenue last week, after reading some of the reviews, but we needn't have worried. I'd asked for a quieter back room, which we were allocated. Our room was spotless and larger than a lot of others that I've stayed in. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff polite. The location of the hotel was spot on, only a couple of minutes walk from the railway station. We walked everywhere (the fantastic weather allowed us to wander). We would definately use this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue Hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JCNottingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avenue hotel in February. Hotel rooms were a little on the small side BUT had everything you wanted in them for a short stay. Good powerful showers! Comfortable beds! only no coffee/tea in rooms!! Breakfasts were good, lots to choose from so you need not go hungry. Really central to Dam Square and within walking distance of Anne Franks House. Check out the cake shop down the road towards dam square. OPen to 4am! Amazing and great after a night out!! All staff friendly and polite in hotel. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ald123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Avenue with 13 friends for a girls weekend, the room was fine and clean , breakfast was very nice can't really complain. Hotel staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great girls holiday!”
Reviews.Author: loudurant_84
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend over the 12th jan with 2 other girls. stayed in a 3 bed room it was quite small one bed being a fold out bed from the wall. But just enough space. Basic furnishing, not a hotel to go to if you want 5 star but if you are planning to go to amsterdam for the night life, and will only be spending a few hours a nite there, its clean and they offer a free breakfast! we had a room at the front and if you leave the window open it can be noisy as trams go past all the time. The best thing about this hotel was the position. Really close to the station, takes a couple of minutes to walk, defenetly not worth getting a cab. Its also right in the middle of everything about 4 mins walk to dam square and there shops and resturants all the way down to dam square as well. There are lots of good bars in amsterdam, but be careful of the red light district as ive found quite a few people were riped off!!! and also one bar tried to accuse a group of people of using fake notes! But if its clubs your after they arnt located in dam square, i think about 10mins walk. Something i didnt know before i went was that you have to pay in nearly all the bars to go to the loo about 50cent. so take change! I went mostly for the night life but the shopping is good and also managed to vist the sex and erotic museum. The erotic is the better one and located in the red light. Altogether a great hotel for the price, helpful staff and a great city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Costly mistake”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkiesFromNowOn
Reviews.Content: I paid for a round-trip shuttle from and to the airport. When I checked into the hotel, I told the clerk to make a 10:00 AM reservation for me on the shuttle the next morning. She told me that she did so, but she did NOT. The next morning when this was discovered, I had to order a taxi to get to the airport on time, which cost me about $50, and the hotel would only reimburse me the cost of half the shuttle ticket (9.5 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: princesspentium
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending the weekend (2 nights - Fri & Sat ) at the Avenue Hotel. It was a cold, wet night when we finally arrived at 11.45pm after a delayed flight to Schipol. Being close to Centraal Station the hotel is a short walk. Our twin room ( I was sharing with a girlfriend) was on the 3rd floor at the end of a long twisting corridor. I had emailed the hotel direct a few days previously and asked for a quiet non smoking room - which we got. The 3rd floor is completely non smoking. The room was small - the 2 single beds were pushed together and no room to separate them - so make sure you share with a good friend. One pillow and a duvet for each bed was provided. There is a TV (which we didnt use) and very limited storage space - just a small wardrobe with 2 shelves, not great if staying for longer than a couple of days! The radiator was off when we arrived but gave us enough warmth when we wanted it & to dry our towels. The bathroom had a shower, wc & wash basin. The shower was a problem as mentioned in previous reviews. The floor is on one level with just a curtain rail in the ceiling around the shower head, from which the shower curtain hangs. The shower head is fixed and when the shower is on (its very powerful) the water sprays through the gap in the side of the curtains and soaks anything on the washbasin's side. The floor is like a lake as the water doesnt drain away as fast as is necessary, so on stepping out of the shower the bathmat is saturated. Whoever designs this had NOT thought it through! BUT still..... we managed, although we didnt spend long getting clean! I have to mention the low level of lighting in the room too, which was very frustrating when trying to read & unpack in the smi darkness - we made an attempt at removing a lampshade from a bedside light but couldnt budge it! Breakfast was good - as mentioned by previous reviewers, cereals,juices (not fresh squeezed) fruit salad (though tinned) plain yogurt, cold meats, cheese, tomatoes, cucumber, assorted rolls and bread. There was a hot choice too, bacon, baked beans, rather solid scrambled eggs, sausages (frankfurters) small pancakes (which looked rather like ravioli) and boiled eggs. Coffee was provided in large hot jugs and was very weak! Tea bags and hot water was available too. You could easily fill up before you went out to see the sights. We found the reception desk staff helpful with advice on trams and tickets. We didnt try the small bar at the hotel. We had prebooked by email, a retaurant off Dam square called Brasserie Harkema - I would recommend it for a great meal in a buzzy atmosphere. Its housed in a converted tobacco factory and has an excellent if short menu. price for 3 courses and a good bottle of wine Â£56 with service. We saw all the sights - Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank House and did a canal boal trip - catch it from outside Centraal Sation. Love Amsterdam - my 6th trip and my friends first - we will be back and despite the niggles think that the Avenue Hotel is good value & in an ideal position to see everything - a tram stop virtually outside the door helps. Might upgrade to a superior twin next time though - just to get better lighting and more space!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AESCH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property for an extended week-end break and in order to visit some art exhibitions and quite like it. PROS: - location fairly central, good access to sights with public transport - room was very quiet, in the back ... in front probably quite loud - adequate in size, good bedding - nice and efficient staff - outstanding buffet breakfast CONS: - bathroom though clean and adequate in size, was very basic, the shower was a joke .... a hole in the floor .... - breakfast room, can get really packed and you don't have enough space to move around - no restaurant but this is not a real problem since have enough eating places in neighbourhood ALL IN ALL A GOOD PLACE, WOULD PROBABLY RETURN

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: ClarePete97
Reviews.Content: We stayed for New year last year in the Avenue hotel and again for new year this year, cant really go wrong, 5 mins walk from all attrations - great location. Rooms are basic but warm, comfy and clean just what you need (apart from a fridge). Quality breakfast choices, hot and cold (cereal, bread, jams, american style meat, salad, sausage, bacon, scrambled egg etc) the one downfall they do not do toast i asked but they said no! We also requested a room again at the back of the hotel so the trams do not wake us up early. - Always a good idea. Hotel staff friendly reception is open 24 hours, easy check in we left our luggage in locked room as we were 4 hours early and an easy check out, again left luggage in room flight not till tea time - PERFECT. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel. Clare

Reviews.Title: “Gary's 40th birthday”
Reviews.Author: mummymik
Reviews.Content: I took my hubby for his 40th Birthday, dont think he will forget his 40th after what happened. just watch your bag ladies and gentlemen keep your hand in your pocket on your money....petty theifs are very clever..but not clever enough for us.... Was very nice hotel,clean but found the room was bit on the small side, the toilet felt loose and we were scared to put any weight on it incase it fell of the wall. had amugging on the streets of amsterdam hotel receptionist was very good, but found police never wanted to know. and people just stood and watched instead of helping. apart from this yes had a good time and will go back but would have upgraded room. breakfast was a lovely american style. and staff were polite and helpful. Thankyou for a pleasant stay. and hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and sleep disturbed”
Reviews.Author: Adam-Chance
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2006, we had an early flight from Stansted, Amsterdam Central station is only a short walk from the hotel which is good, we were not able to have our pre-booked room untill 2pm, although the next morning (Saturday) I was woken up before 9am by cleaners in the adjacent room bumping around and using vacuum cleaners, My room shared the same wooden floor joists as the adjacent room so every step that someone next door made was felt. Noise and vibrations from trams was incredible, they go through the foundations, Trams finish around 1am and start about 6am, so if you want to relax and have proper a nights sleep this is not the right hotel for you. The breakfast room is too small for the size of hotel and has overflow tables in the corridor. I wont be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jackjan
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 9.30 am on Saturday, November 4. Room not ready as expected. To fill in time we did a canal cruise. Room was ready after 2 pm. Very basic/no frills/standard room WITH BATH. Very difficult to get out of the room door, just as well no emergency exit required. Reported to front desk for reporting to housekeeping. Still difficult. As you know this Hotel serves 'hot' breakfast only. For our 2 breakfast mornings, we were first into the room. Only hot food was hard boiled egg. The other items were not hot (are they ever?). No prunes, bircher muesli. NO TOASTER. On the Sunday we did a tour and when back at about 3 pm our room still not cleaned. Back downstairs to wait for the housemaid to do room. Left husband resting in the lobby whilst I went for a sightseeing walk. After 4 pm room done and we discovered that milk and soft drink we had placed in an 'ice bucket' on a bench had been removed. Advised reception who told me to let housekeeping know the next morning. Very difficult to obtain ice (they have no ice machine and will only provide a small glass full of ice - we used the rubbish bin as ice bucket). We booked a shuttle to the Airport through the hotel which was handled efficiently. The hotel 'takes all credit cards' but apparently not Amex. We liked the security door system. The bed was a small double with the usual doona/duvet. We had to have window open (noisy Saturday night) and feet/arms out from cover and still too hot to sleep. Also we both had bad problems after 2 nights. Actually when we arrived in Singapore (via Heathrow) we were taken off the 'plane in wheelchairs. Hotel in Singapore had an excellent massage chair which helped a lot in our recovery (will do separate review)

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: gallerybrowser
Reviews.Content: After reading some reports we were unsure of what to expect. We arrived to a very friendly greeting. I had written to ask for a quiet room and was given one on the side but this had been upgraded from a standard twin and was roomy, warm,comfy, spotless and had a well equipped bathroom with a powerful overbath shower and piping hot water. We could still hear the trams and a little street noise but carry ear plugs which dealt with that. The breakfast room is pretty and the food varied and enjoyable. My husband, given to such ways of passing the time noticed that every single light bulb was working in the public areas and there are many. We made use of the safe deposit facility and the suitcase storage as our flight was not till evening on our last day.The dish of love heart sweets on the recepetion were fun too and without exception the staff were pleasant and helpful-and to think I nearly changed my booking.

Reviews.Title: “A Break from the Kids”
Reviews.Author: redchantilly
Reviews.Content: October 13th, our 2nd weekend away from the kids in 11 years. On the whole NOT BAD! Enjoyed Amsterdam. Stayed at The Avenue Hotel, great location, walking distance to Central Station. Not too noisy, except for the bell chimes every hour with a rendition of "Onward Christian Soldiers". Hotel a bit quirky, but staff friendly and helpful, though no plug in bathroom sink, why? don't know, and shower not very good. Rooms are quite small but adequate. All you can eat for breakfast if you really want it after a hangover, fry ups, traditional cheeses, hams, rolls, fruit etc., Sent boyfriend down to bar for refreshments but bar closes at midnight. If you are into smoking it's a paradise for you, offered to you constantly, and the sex scene is certainly an eye opener. The live shows and cinemas are more of a laugh than anything, but do go with an open mind. Lin, Solihull

Reviews.Title: “VERY NOISY AND NO AIRCON!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jay152
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Hotel from 17th to 21st July 2006 in a triple room and i must say i was a little disapointed at the overall hotel. We were put into a tiny room for 3 people right on the front street.....big mistake...VERY noisy....trams sound like they are coming through the room...like a mini eathquake every 5 mins and loads of noise from passing tourists all hours, the foldy out bed was broken in the room aswell. We asked to be moved next day and the staff were a bit off as they said that's what you should expect and it's only to 1am for the trams and they start back at 6am...so 5hours will do anyone wont it...lol. The new room was at the side of hotel (put us in a double superior which was larger than the triple) and was like stoner alley at night....more noise from stoners. Then there was the heat in the Rooms RED hot we had to sleep with wet towels on us to cool down, no air con apart from breakfast room. In conclusion here are the plus points and minus points to the hotel..... Plus Points:- Great Location Great Breakfast Very Clean Opposite an English Pub...lol Negative Points:- VERY NOISY NO AIRCON....Like a furnace in rooms Stoner Alley to the side of hotel Staff very off if you make a complaint. Hope this helps....would have helped us....The renanisance looked really nice when i walked past by the way but never went inside so couldn't really comment.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-Beaumont
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel whilst in Amsterdam watching the World Cup. Excellent location - 5 mins walk from Central Station. Rooms were fine - satellite television, good shower, comfy beds etc. Little bit of noise from trams but we were at side of hotel - would suggest you ask for room there. Breakfast was included and had a good choice - even if you only had coffee and croissants. Also, hotel bar was cheapest place we found for beer - half price of Grasshopper. If you want a central, clean, economical base that you do not intend to spend a lot of time in then this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just two days ago, I returned to Virginia from Amsterdam, where I spent 3 nights at the Avenue Hotel. After making my reservation and reading several Trip Advisor reviews, I was a bit concerned about streeet noise, surley staff, and other negatives. My room was on the back side of the hotel; I never heard street noise, trams, or more than some other guests whose windows were also open. Breakfast at the Avenue Hotel is an amazing array in the traditional Dutch style: cereals, breads, cheese and coldcuts, fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, pankcakes, etc. The Avenue is one street away from the main tourist shopping area, and the main street from the Central Train Station. Trams to all parts of the city are a short distance from the hotel. Numerous restaurants are in the area of the hotel. The downside of the Avenue is the price, but it is competitive with other hotels of similar quality in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy and poor room lighting”
Reviews.Author: Penticles
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in April. The first room we were given was below street level with the windows just above the pavement. We asked to be relocated higher up and were offered a twin room. Good Points: - Great Location from the train station/Dam Square etc - Great Breakfast - really good value. - Spacious room Bad Points: - The lighting was utterly poor. With all the light bulbs on,we could hardly see what we were unpacking (no kidding!!) After complaining for nothing, we ended up purchasing 2 75watts bulbs to replace the 25 watt ones they had fitted. - Prepare for a lot of noise.The windows have no double glazing and though we were on the side of the hotel one could still hear the tram and occasionally shouting of partygoers at all times of the night. Conclusion Unless you are there to stay out the entire night and don't mind the noise don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location close to train station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in April. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the location is perfect being a five-minute walk to train station. Although close to the train station this hotel is not in a seedy area. Our room was the most spacious we had in the two weeks we were in Europe. The room was clean but all the chairs were badly stained and all could use a good cleaning. The breakfast room was large and cheerful. There was plenty to eat and something for everyone's taste. Do not, however, eat what looks like scrambled eggs. They are actually tofu, I think. They were pretty gross to say the least but all the other food was very tasty. I chose this hotel because it had an elevator which is somewhat hard to find in Amsterdam. The hotel lacked the old charm of Amsterdam being more an American-style hotel but my husband and I were pleased with the hotel and woud stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Skotch
Reviews.Content: Only a 5 minute walk from Central Train Station, this great little hotel is a gem in the centre of Amsterdam. Friendly and welcoming staff and a fantastic breakfast to set you up for the rest of your day. It's location is ideal for visiting most central locations on foot, though trams run past the hotel at frequent intervals. For example - 10 mins walk to Ann Franke Museum and the Jordaan region, 5 minutes to Dam Square and the Palace and Neuw Kerk museums (and Plaza Mayor shopping Mall). 10 minutes to the flower market, 20 minutes to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. The only negative I would say is the late night noise of the trams going by. Other than that, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this gem to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Its warm inside”
Reviews.Author: Roojill
Reviews.Content: Spent three days here. Weather outside cold and wet, but hotel thoroughly warm and inviting. Excellent staff and brilliant breakfast. Beds very comfortable, room smallish but adequate. Bathroom very roomy- high standard of decor and cleanliness. Would definitely use this hotel again- a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Bad expeience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel was good, it was close to the central station and the breakfast was good and there was plenty of food. With that in mind I would never stay at this hotel again. The beds and pillows were miserably uncomfortable and the front desk staff tried to overcharge us when we checked in and then tried to say that we didn't pay for the room as we were checking out. The staff finally beleived us when we showed them a payment receipt. There were a lot of other hotels that were nicer in the same location and for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GOGATraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but the location and price cannot be beat. The staff was friendly and plenty of food on the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: dondilyons
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with this hotel. Excellent location, walking distance to almost everything. We had a quad room with a good amount of space. 2 beds were in a loft upstairs, and with the windows and the loft you could really experience some of Amsterdam's unique architecture. I found good prices on the internet, but when I e-mailed the hotel with some questions, they beat the lowest internet price, saving me 90 euros a night from the original rate I found! The breakfast was good and easy. I felt the hotel was very safe and secure. Parking was easy in the lot underneath, costing 35 euros a day. I'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: moderndc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Excellent hot buffet breakfast. Friendly & helpful staff. We stayed here twice, once in a double and once in a triple...both rooms were very large - the double had a bed and a futon, and the triple had a gorgeous bathroom. great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kkyh
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay: 9-11 December 2005 Accommodation: Double Room This hotel is located within walking distance of Centraal Station (about 5 minutes) and is equally close to the Red Light District and shopping areas. Dam Square is about 10 minutes away and Leidseplein and Museumplein are all accessible by a single tram. Overall, the hotel was very comfortable with clean, well-maintained rooms. Breakfast was nothing special but we appreciated a little sustenance in the morning. Great value, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam for its cleanliness and ideal location!

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort in the world's coolest city”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay at the Avenue Hotel Nov 11-13 on a long weekend of fun and debauchery in A'dam. The hotel is in a great spot in the heart of the old center of Amsterdam, a short walk from Centraal Station. (Lugging bags and lazy, I took the tram two stops from Centraal to Niewezijds Kolk - the Avenue is to the left). The lobby is very nice with a nice bar/lounge up a half flight of steps. The staff was very courteous and professional, and I was able to check in immediately. The rooms aren't going to win any boutique-chic awards, but are very modern with all the necessary conveniences. (My single looked like a smaller version of a Courtyard by Marriott room.) The bed was very comfy, and space was adequate. The bathroom was a bit small, but not claustrophobic. Also, I would have appreciated a couple of more towels, but I think that's one of those wasteful American habits we could really afford to get over. The breakfast buffet included with the room rate was great - lots of pastries, cold cuts, fruit, juices, cereals, rolls, and even bacon, eggs and sausage. The coffee was excellent. (It seems hard to find bad coffee in Europe, unlike here!!) The location is superb. From the Niewezijds tram stop across from the hotel, trams go directly to the Leidseplein, Museumplein and Jordaan areas. Trams to the rest of the city can be accessed at Centraal. The hotel is a very short walk from Dam Square, the cheesily commercial Damrak and, of course, the Red Light District. Overall, a great stay in an incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Avenue gets my approval !!”
Reviews.Author: Bedders
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to celebrate a special event namely my girlfriend / partners 40th birthday. The reason for the choice of this particular hotel was because we wanted a hotel that was within walking distance from the train station & one that was based around a traditional Dutch warehouse design or traditional townhouse . We especially did not want to stay in a modern thrown-up monstrosity that seems to be frequenting many big cities around the world these days! (You know the saying:- 'When in Rome do as the Romans do!!') The hotel was in a very nice area of town, quiet & not near the seedy or rowdy areas & approximatley 200 metres from Dam Square; the main Dam when Amsterdam was first dammed all those years ago. Within the Dam Squaure area is the Royal Palace. The Hotel staff were very kind & pleasent when we used them to check in & for buying tickets (at a later time) to use the expansive tram network that stops convientiently 100 metres down the road. The room we stayed in was on the 6th floor reached by a lift. It was plesant with both bath & overhead powershower with plenty of very warm water. It also had a hairdyer & razor socket. The room was nicely decorated with twin beds. It had t.v with Dutch, German , UK & U.S stations mainly news networks to keep you in touch with affairs back at home if you wish. As we stayed in November we were worried that the hotel may be a liitle cold, but we needn't have worried as it was toastie warm & cosy. Next on to the breakfast.The breakafast was out-of-this-world!!! It was a self-service affair with the choice of:- fruit, croissants, bread & rolls in both brown & white, conserves / jams, juice , tea , coffee, warm milk, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, small dutch pancakes, tomato, ham, cheese (plain Gouda & one which i especially liked was the Gouda with cumin), lettuce, cucumber. I've probably forgotten loads as there really was that much to choose from. Amazing!!!! Most people in previous reviews commented on the noisy trams, but to be honest they never really distrubed us. To be fair if you want to stay in the centre of Amsterdam you would be hard-pushed to pick a hotel that avoids any tram noise as the tram network is that good; which can only be a good thing whilst you are travelling around & visiting the many various places of interest. Top marks from us-faultless on our visit anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husand & I had stayed in this hotel 2 years ago and had thought it was quite a good place to stay, however after our most recent stay we have changed our minds! Check in was fine & staff were friendly and we where given a nice clean & warm room, it was small but comfortable. The bathroom was tiny and we had problems while using the shower as water sprayed all over the bathroom floor when using the shower. It was rather old in decor but that is to be expected ion a hotel of this type ( after all it is an old warehouse conversion) At night is when the problems began! The fan in the bathroom whcih is supposed to come on & off with the lightswitch was broken so there was no way for us to turn off the fan & it ran continuosly. I called reception at around 10 om and the man at the desk was most unhelpful and had no interest in helping us. He did not offer another room & said as he was the only staff member left he could not leave the front desk in case other guests needed to be let into the hotel. He then said that we would have to wait until morning. I explained that we were having a hard time falling asleep due to the noise. ( it was very loud and right next to us as the room was tiny & even if we shut the door we could still hear it. I have read other peoples posts complaining about the trams going by and the noise of the clock tower but this did not bother us one bit compared to the humming of the fan. Breakfast was good and plentiful. After breakfast we went to reception to mention the fan again and the lady at the desk said that she would have someone look at it that day & it would be sorted. However when we retunrned later that day the fan was still running and we had to endure yet another night of it! A good point about the hotel is the location to the city as well as the Train station. The lack of caring shown by the staff has really put us off the Avenue Hotel. It seems as though they just ignore their guests and are clearly bothered by them. We will not be returning to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A damn good place in the Dam!”
Reviews.Author: The_Boogles
Reviews.Content: Our aim was to find a budget hotel that didn't feel like a budget hotel. We accomplished this and more at Avenue. For around 100 euro, we had a cute room on the top floor. The view wasn't anything to write home about (as it fronted on an alley way) but it did offer peace and quite throughout the night. Space is a luxury you don't get in this hotel - but then again, that's sort of par for the course in Europe. As small as it was, it was still very cozy. The room was equipped with a TV, french balcony, and wonderful bathroom. Everything was immaculate even by my germ phobic standards. Breakfast was top notch, with both cold and hot dishes available in a buffet fashion. The only qualm we have with the hotel is that our flight had delayed us a day, and they still charged us for the room. Even though that left a bit of a bad taste in our mouths, we still have only good things to say about Avenue in the end. Definitely a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scousemouse1964
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel is ideally located for all Amsterdam's usual attractions. This was my first visit to Amsterdam and didn't know what to expect. I was very pleasantly surprised with the Avenue Hotel. The room was spotlessly clean and adequate for a 3nt stay. The breakfast included in your rate was excellent and replenished on a regular basis. The staff at the hotel could not be faulted. Very friendly and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel and if I go back to Amsterdam, I would book the Avenue Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off!”
Reviews.Author: LesleyKJ62
Reviews.Content: By the lacklustre reviews on this site. We stayed in a triple room for two nights. Yes the trams are noisy, but just take earplugs! The hotel is clean, efficient and we found the staff very helpful and polite (suitcase storage meant we could relax and enjoy our first and last full days). The breakfast is fab, but do get down before 10 am to make sure you get your hands on some of the yummy pancakes! It's an absolutely brilliant location, just 10 minutes walk from the station and on the right side of town. The train from the airport is really easy to catch and very quick and the hotel is just 10 minutes walk away from the station on the other side of the canal. We used the hop on hop off canal bus, which was cheap (given that you can use it for a full day then up to 12pm the following day). Book and catch the canal bus from outside the station. Do visit the Rijksmuseum (I'm no art buff, but it's still worth a visit) and the Anne Frank house (you may have to queue but not for too long and it's well worth the very reasonable entrance fee). Finally we recommend a tapas bar called La Gusta on the same road as the hotel - fantastic food, lovely authentic and friendly environment and excellent service! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, but the location is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I already know what to expect from a hotel for 110 Euro per night in Amsterdam, I wasn't dissapointed by the small room, tiny bathroom, lack of air condition, very small double bed. The room was clean, except one chair that had bad stains on the seat. The breakfast was weak, at least for european standards. The location is really great though, you're just one block off Damstrat and there's a tram outside the door. The guy at the front desk told us, that the whole hotel only has 5 double rooms so switching rooms for a couple is not that easy, especially on the week-end. PS: We had no! mice in our room!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,LOCATION and LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: evab
Reviews.Content: The location is the best. My room was small with a view of a roof. Breakfast average but tasty. Clean and warm but this year they asked for 130 euros per night instead of 97,00 euros that I paid January 2005. WHY ? I did not understand this increase. So, i decided to choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very happy with this hotel. It is located in the heart of the city, near one of the main shopping streets and only a few blocks from Dam Square. In addition, if you need to get anywhere, it is less than a block from the tram and a few blocks from the Central Train Station. The room was small but comfortable. The bathroom looked as if it were recently renovated and was beautiful. It had a big clean tub. Our room was over the street and there was significant street noise. The trams were quite loud, as were the numerous people on the street. Luckily, we are not light sleepers. The breakfast included cereal, breads, croissants, coffee, juice, sausage, and small pancakes. It was delicious! We were very happy with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of mice in your room !!”
Reviews.Author: ShaheenFC
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Avenue based on reviews posted on this site and booked a quad room for our familly of two adults and two young children. I had emailed several weeks in advance notifying the hotel that we would need to check in a couple of hours earlier than standard time and was told that this would be fine. Upon our arrival I was told that our room was not ready and that it would be another two or three hours before our room became available. I stored our luggaage at the hotel and we went out site seeing for three hours. When we came back we were told that our room is ready. Once we entered the room, we found out that room was not cleaned yet, bed was un-made and there were towels and trash on the bathroom floor. Once again we came out to the lobby and waited for about an hour for the room to be cleaned. By this time it was about 4:00 PM and my 6 years old was pretty frustrated. After a quick shower we went out for dinner and decided to call it the night so the kids could rest. My 9 year old was watching TV and we were all dosing off when my son woke me to tell me he saw a mouse in the room. It may have been the exhaustion or lack of sleep that made me tell him that he was imagining thigs and I made him go to bed. The following night we came back to our room with some left over food in paper bags and fell asleep right away. My wife awoke to the sound of mice, yes several mice!. trying to get into the paper bags. At two in the morning I got dressed and went down to notify the gentleman at the reception. I was told that the hotel was completly booked up and the manager would be in at 9:00 and there was nothing he could do about the situation. Needless to say, this made for an interesting evening. At 6:00 I went out walked around and found us a room at the Renaissance hotel, a 5 star hotel, two blocks away for less than what we were charged at the Avenue. We checked out at 8:00 in the morning. At the check out time the hotel manager first tried to charge me for the entire amount for two nights, then offered a discount. But I was firm about paying only for the first night. Hotel Renaissance was wonderful, their personnel were extremely helpfull and we ended up having a wonderful time in Amsterdam. For those interested, Rijksmuseum is under construction, and more that 2/3 of the art work is not available. Canal Bikes are wonderful for kids and the floating flower market is beautiful in the morning. Have a great time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in the heart of Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: fredandkell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avenue Hotel in Amsterdam on April 2-4, 2005. The hotel is very close to the train station - you just turn right at the big Victoria hotel and take your next left at the major road, which is the Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal, and the hotel is about 3 blocks on your left, just beside the Crown Plaza.
