Note: when taking the train from the airport to Centraal Station, buy your tickets from a person. The machines are only in Dutch and do not take credit cards, only Dutch debit cards. We requested a room at the back, having heard the trams are noisy (they are), and that worked out well. Pros of the room: decent size, lots of wardrobe/desk space, 2 English channels on the TV, quiet, super location. Cons: no AC (didn't need it in April but could imagine it would get hot in the summer), non-smoking rooms are right next to smoking rooms so we kept getting wafts of smoke (had to stuff towels against crack under door), "sheets" consisted of a duvet thing which was hot, and as there was no separate sheet, you just had to either use the duvet or do without, and also there is this giant clock in Dam Square that rings incessantly, we're talking every 15 minutes, even at night. Obviously not the hotel's fault but annoying, and you can hear it all over the city, so no escaping it. The hotel had a SUPER breakfast buffet - hot and cold foods, fruit, cheeses, you name it. Amsterdam itself was fabulous. LOVED IT. Things to do there: Van Gogh museum was great; Anne Frank house is a must-see; rent a bike like the locals do! Heineken Brewery tour was fun as well. We thought the Rijksmuseum was boring and overrated; wouldn't recommend unless you really are into the Dutch masters. Trams are a super way to get around; easy city to explore on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Avenue for three nights. All I can say is everything was perfect. The public areas were immaculate, the room was comfortable and clean the staff were friendly and the breakfast buffet was brilliant. We asked for a quiet room and thats what we got at the back of the hotel. Also the location was perfect, close to everything. Iwould highly recommend the Avenue Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuardianFairy
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed her in March 2005. We booked it online and got a very reasonable price, given that this hotel is in the city centre, close to Central Station and of a good standard. The room was excellent, spotlessly clean with modern facilities. The breakfast offered variety and was filling and the staff were always pleasant and smiling. The only downside was the noise outside the hotel which meant the room window couldn't be opened on a night time. The hotel is close to all the attractions (e.g. canal boats, shopping streets, Dam Square) and is a 5 minute walk from the train station (follow the street that trams 1 & 5 go down). Come out of the hotel and walk left a few paces and you'll find the best restaurant in Amsterdam. Its called Humphreys and is located next door to the Tulip Inn. They offer a set 3 course menu with a choice of 5 dishes for each course for only 18.95 Euros. The atmosphere is very intimate, the staff are wonderful and the food is Mmmmmm!!! Overall I can highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a good Location”
Reviews.Author: JONESAD
Reviews.Content: Just retyrned from a stag weekend, we had two triple rooms which were fine but more imortantly clean. The only complaint about the room was how noisy it was from the trams that run outside the window. As there is no Air Con in the rooms we had the window open and it was very noisy. If I wnt agian I would request a room on the inside. The breakfast was very good, the location great, about 5 min walk from dam saquare and the staff were friendly. Overall good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wcinro
Reviews.Content: The Avenue Hotel was a great bargain for the money. We stayed there in September 2004 and were quite pleased with the hotel. We read the reviews on it in Trip Advisor and based our choice on them. The hotel was well located, clean, nicely furnished, and the breakfast was terrific. The staff was more than helpful. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, Brilliant location and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nporiord
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and have to say for a budget hotel the room was clean (if a bit small) and the staff were very friendly. The location was also excellent being very close to the central station and convenient for all the night spots. If you are planning on hitting the town for a weekend give this place a try. You could do a lot worse. A hearty buffet breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in a double room with my girlfriend. Had everything we wanted, rooms were clean along with the bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. Well worth the money we payed and will use the avenue when returning to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand all the good reviews???”
Reviews.Author: Brianinmilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I agree completely with the last reviewer. The one saving grace for this hotel was the location. Very close to Central Station and most of main attractions but that was about it. My room was over the main street and it was very noisy. Trams and busses start running at 6am so if you are not used to city noise choose a room toward the back of the hotel. The rooms were tiny even for European standards. The rooms were clean but worn and were horribly designed. The room phone did not work when trying to call the states and my wife could not get through to me either. Thankfully I had a quad band cell phone that I just had to switch the sim card to be able to communicate with home. The front desk staff was average at best. One of the front desk people was very nice (a woman - forgot her name) but the rest seemed irratated at the 3 questions I asked them in the 8 days I was there. I noticed they seemed very put out when other guests were talking to them. There is a small bar but never had anyone in there. There was one computer in the bar for internet service. The computer worked but not the internet. No wireless internet. Breakfast was the same everyday and average. I am not one to complain - I have never written a bad review for anything before but in my opinion you can do much better for the same money in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mabel_Madison
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand what all the fuss is about. I didn't think this hotel was that great at all. In fact, I thought it looked in a rather fragile state. Obviously, it could've been just my room. For nearly Â£100 per night, I expected a lot more from this 3* star hotel. We've booked a double room but were given a twin room instead. We were told that no double room would become available. Our room was tiny. The twin beds were pushed together and there was no space to separate them. Both beds kept sliding away from each other though. The TV sat snug between the ceiling and the walls, clearly because there was no space to fit it else where. The bathroom was an absolute disgrace. I could tell it was clean but it looked filthy with the moulded and broken tiles. The shower was just a showerhead spraying on the bathroom floor. The breakfast was hot buffet and okay. I wouldn't rave about it though. The location was perfect. It is very close to Central Station and a short walk away from the Dam. I have always stayed near Central Station but I think it has become very gritty in the past years. Next time I'll go to Amsterdam I'd rather stay in the Jordaan which is by far the greatest location in Amsterdam and not all bulldozed by hen and stag parties. I've been disappointed by hotel Avenue, then again, I haven't seen any of the other rooms therefore cannot compare.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue Hotel for 4 nights in May 2004 and overall, I enjoyed my stay. Having said that, I think your experience of this hotel will very much depend on the type of room which you are allocated. As the hotel is made up of old canal houses, the rooms vary widely in size and many of the rooms are oddly shaped. I had a single room which was very small and poky, with no window and a bathroom which could do with some updating. However, I had called up the hotel in advance to request a nice room for my parents and they were allocated a spacious double room which was clean, well furnished and very pleasantly decorated. Their bathroom was fairly small but clean, modern and perfectly functional. Their room did overlook the street so there was some noise from passing trams etc but they didn't find it too bad. The public areas of the hotel are pleasant, well decorated and clean and, as other reviewers have mentioned, the complimentary buffet breakfast is a great bonus. This hotel is in a good location for trams, and for the dam square end of town, plenty of shops, bars and restaurants etc in the immediate vicinity of the hotel and not too much of a walk from the other nighlife areas such as Rembrandtsplein. The tram from just outside the hotel will also take you right down to Leidseplein. For evening meals, I would highly recommend Humphrey's restaurant which is in one of the side streets just down from the hotel (underneath the Golden Tulip Inntel Hotel) which serves very high quality fixed price menus in a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel IF...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ..you get a room that does not face the street. Very important, remember that. Other than that, everything in the hotel was great. Location was perfect, breakfast was good, rooms were clean, staff was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Brenda29
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a visit to Amsterdam where we stayed at the Avenue Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The room was clean and well decorated, the bathroom was spacious and had a hairdryer, shower and bath. The breakfast was excellent, there was so much to choose from and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We will be staying at the Avenue on our next visit as it is also in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “some rooms are miniscule”
Reviews.Author: BettyEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue two years ago. Overall the hotel was OK (2-3 star/no frills) but the room we were allocated was tiny. We asked to be moved to a larger (standard) room but were told all the rooms were the same. We decided to leave and check into a decent hotel. On departing, we could see open doors to much more substantial bedrooms. Moved to the Marriot which was the business. Much nicer area too. In brief, hotel OK but be canny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast and price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Stayed here 20th-22nd November. The hotel is clean, tidy and the staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is also a filler which sets you up nicely. Hotel is well located 5 mins walk from Centraal Station and Dam Square. Overall, a hotel well worthy of a look. Was only Â£80 for the 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “Well impressed”
Reviews.Author: wellso
Reviews.Content: A party of 4 went booked into the Avenue based on reviews from this website. This was our second visit to Amsterdam this year and we were all very impressed with the Avenue. We stayed in a quad room which was a good size and the room was clean. The staff were more than friendly and helpful and i thought the location of the hotel was ideal - not far from the station and close to all the attractions that we were interested in. I can't recommend this hotel enough - so much so we have already planned our next trip to Amsterdam and have rebooked to stay at the Avenue!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Only so-so location”
Reviews.Author: love2Et
Reviews.Content: Our room was extremely comfortable - roomy, clean and nicely decorated. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was better than most. The tram runs directly in front of the hotel, which was great! The hotel is also very centrally located - within a 5 minute walk from the Central Station. To me, this was a drawback. Lots of shaggy-looking kids with backpacks walking around and tons of souvenir stands and very touristy restaurants nearby. If I were to come back, I'd look for something comparable but situated in a more elegant part of town (the Jordan district?), preferably overlooking a canal; with a better selection of restaurants and cafes within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from A'Dam 16/10/04 .before booking our 5day trip to the Avenue hotel we first looked up the trip advisor reviews,most reviews were spot on so we were not dissapointed when we checked in, yes it is three star but i can tell you that a couple of other so called 3* hotels in and around the same area didnt have a patch on the Avenue. as for the accomadation ,we had a double room situated 3 floors up(lift access to all floors) running down an alley way (so what) less noise as the front of the hotel had trams running up and down from early morning till late at night. not the hotels fault as the 5* crown plaza hotel is next door they also had same problem. the toilet is a bit small but full bath and shower with sink and hair dryer done the job. full breakfast included cold meats,cheese,cereals coffeee tea and juices, also bacon egg sausages and pancakes as much as you could eat to set you up for the day. all staff were very polite and nothing was a problem. security isnt a problem either at night someone is always on the door(reception area) which has to be opened by touch pad from the inside , safe deposit boxes in locked room requiring 2 key system, and also a left luggage room for the last day which is also locked and free. if i was ever going back to the Dam then i would certainly go back to the Avenue if its 5* your looking for then book 5* but if you cant afford it then go to the Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very well situated however i thought to expensive for what you got. I have been to Amsterdam 8 times and this was the first time in this hotel and i believe there are better for the price if you look around. The hotel offers room service and there is even a button on your room phone for this however when you ring it they say this service is not available so why say you do???? The good thing is breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Central, reasonably priced and safe”
Reviews.Author: GillB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May as a result of the comments here. Am going back in a couple of weeks' time which has to be the best recommendation. Really what everyone else said - friendly, English-speaking staff, excellent breakfast buffet, 5 minutes' walk one way to the station, the other way to Dam Square, another way to the canals. Pleasant neighbourhood and, for a female travelling on her own, a safe environment. The only beef I might have is that the single room I had was very small, looking out over an alleyway, but it's an old building so that's understandable. Overall a nice central reasonably priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SASHALOVESPARIS2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avenue in Amsterdam, Netherlands in April 2004. Great service, centrally located and close to all. Great staff and excellent BREAKFAST! Would definately stay there on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean, and good price”
Reviews.Author: Hentschke
Reviews.Content: I have booked this three-star-plus accomodation through Connect Hotel in England and received, in advance, a brochure of the hotel and tourist information about Amsterdam. Their service was impeccable. I paid Â£85 for one night in April, not cheap but good price for value in a major European capital. The hotel has a friendly atmosphere and is clean. It is close to both the station and the city centre with its tourist sights. There are other, four-star and five-star hotels nearby, so you are in a good neighbourhood but spare a few pounds for sightseeing. I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It very near to railway station,Dam square and all the attraction in city center.There is tram station near the hotel which takes u to most importatnt places.Breakfast was amazing and trust me its a hotel i would recommend with closed eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: nanniecath
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location, walking distance from railway station, even with luggage. Helpful friendly staff/everyone speaks English. Breakfast plentiful and served until 10am. Rooms clean ... but so small, totally different to the advertised photograph. The wardrobe had room for just four hangers and the view was of other windows looking down on us over a kind of roof area with discarded cigarette's etc. Asked for a possible room change without luck. As this was a special birthday treat for my husband it was very disappointing. Suggest if you book that you check on your room size first!

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolScousers
Reviews.Content: Hotel recommended by people we both work with. What can we say, excellent htoel, situated in cntre, easily accessible to everything. Very fiendly hotel, staff ery obliging. Breakfast, buffet style was excellent choices of food. Well done Avenue Hotel, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “way more than a 3* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant hotel, somehow right slap bang in the middle of everything, yet just enough out of the way for it to be really quiet and peaceful at night. Our room was on the top floor, was plenty big enough, nice and clean, and with a highly impressive sparkling white en suite bathroom. A door/large window opened overlooking the alleyway near us, which we used to go directly to the centre. Breakfast small yet filling, try the mini potato cakes, they're excellent. The walk to centraal only takes 5 mins tops. If you're going to Amsterdam and intend to be near the centre of town, but far enough away to escape the noise, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Jan 2003 for 3 nights. We where made so welcome by the hotel staff. Very friendly and polite. Our room was ready for us at 10am. Which was great. The room was very nice and bathroom was spotless. Our room had french doors that opened up, which was nice. The buffet breakfast was very good. This was our 3rd stay in Amsterdam, we picked this hotel because we got a great deal. Very glad we stayed there. In fact when we go again in June 2004, we have already rebooked this hotel. We travel a lot to Amsterdam, and like to try out the different hotels. This is well worth a stay, also in a great location. Central Station is a mere 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and solid accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Baltimoron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights while in Amsterdam and could not be better located-five minutes walk from Centraal Station (trains), two minutes walk from the tram. Stayed in a single which was tiny but fairly standard for Europe. Breakfast is good as well. Not deluxe but comfortable for the price-hotels are expensive in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a short break!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here last October for his birthday for a long weekend. I expected it to be a standard 3* B&B but was plesently surprised at how clean and friendly it was. It is down the street from a police station, there is a tram stop nearly right outside and a taxi rank a minutes walk away. The hotel is open all night, but they have a guard on the door... so no matter what time you get come back you can always get in, knowing that no dodgy characters will be following you in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fiorella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avenue hotel for 2 nights 22/3 - 23/3. This hotel is in an excellent location for shopping, sight seeing and only a 5 min walk from the train station. No need to catch any taxi's. The breakfast was excellent, cold meats and cheese as well as bacon, sausage etc, cereals and breads. The only fault i could find was with the size of the rooms. I think we must of had the smallest room in amsterdam, but the power shower made up for it. I would go back to this hotel but i'd ask for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for a 3*** Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Avenue Hotel on three separate occasions. It is conveniently located just a five minute walk from Amsterdam's Centraal Station on a fairly busy, wide street that has cars and trams circulating. It is not the quietest location, but it is lively and surrounded by some pretty buildings. It is just a short walk to Dam Square from the hotel, so you are definitely in the central part of the city. The hotel is a 3 star hotel, so don't expect luxury. That said, it is clean, well furnished, and includes a full buffet breakfast as part of the room cost. The lobby and rooms are tastefully done with modern decor using subdued tones and wooden furnishings. The single rooms are small by American standards, but that is to be expected of hotels in the Avenue's category. If you want large rooms, expect to pay more at more upscale locations. I've stayed at other more expensive three star hotels in Amsterdam and the Avenue is by far the best.

HotelInfo.Name: Avenue Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 33, Amsterdam 1012 RD, The Netherlands
